A Falling Star's Memories.description: The shaft walls vanish and are replaced by an endless field of stars in all direction, as if the viewer were suddenly lost in outer space.
A Falling Star's Memories.hazardDisable: @Check[arcana|dc:40] (master) to unweave the magic left in the wake of the Trinity Star's passage, @Check[thievery|dc:43] (expert) to etch temporary runes to siphon away the magic, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th rank; counteract DC 33) to counteract the magic; three successes are required to disable the trap. Once the PCs are within the trap's overwhelming illusion, they can still attempt these checks to disable it, but the check DCs increase by 2.
A Falling Star's Memories.hazardRoutine:
A Voyage Through the Infinite (1 action) Every round on its turn, the trap inflicts all creatures in the shaft with the perception that they have been hurtling at an unimaginable speed through the vastness of space. The stars are so distant that no indication of movement can be observed or felt beyond that overwhelming mental conviction. At the same time, the creatures feel as if something unimaginably powerful and hungry is chasing them... and gaining on them. Any PC who looks over their shoulder sees that the stars are indeed winking out behind them, as if an immense black object were growing closer or as if the stars themselves were vanishing. While the PC's body is somehow protected by the vastness of space, their minds are not—each PC must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save.

Critical Success As success below, but the creature also realizes they're reliving the memories of Runelord Xanderghul—like him, they're escaping some sort of horrific fate and are hurtling toward Golarion. The next time this creature achieves a critical success against this trap, they suddenly see Golarion loom large, and as they witness their "crash" into the Throne of the Troll King, they suddenly wake, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, in area C1 at the heart Xin-Cyrusian. If any other PCs are still trapped in the Falling Star's Memories, a PC in Xin-Cyrusian knows instinctively that they can call out to those trapped PCs—each PC in Xin-Cyrusian who does so reduces the save DC against A Voyage Through the Infinite for those still trapped by 5.

Success The creature realizes they're experiencing the path the Trinity Star took through the cosmos and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature's grip on reality fades as they experience what seems like years or even decades of hurtling adrift through a vast expanse. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours or increases the value of their stupefied condition by 1 if they're already stupefied.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (or increase the stupefied condition by 2).

Special If this trap would cause a creature's stupefied condition to exceed @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 5}, the creature instead "crashes" to the ground on the hilltop outside, about ten feet from the Throne of the Troll King. The creature takes @Damage[10d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save), and their stupefied condition now has an unlimited duration.
A Falling Star's Memories.name: A Falling Star's Memories

Abysium Sentinel.description:
This creature is crafted from a toxic skymetal known as abysium.

Thassilonian sentinels are crafted in the shapes of skulls or heads.

Sentinel Sets

Thassilonian sentinels were typically carved from marble, ivory, and bronze, easily blending in with most statues. Rarer sentinels carved from wood, coral, and skymetals were often commissioned in sets alongside matching statues to ensure seamless fits or were carefully sculpted for display alone.

2AUM56SkEHtBCfLK.description: 15 feet. A creature beginning its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save to avoid becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). A creature that's already sickened instead becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} on a failure (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure) for 24 hours.
2AUM56SkEHtBCfLK.name: Green Glow

HZiqpXLNb8BDBGs6.description:
Trigger The abysium sentinel becomes aware of an unfamiliar creature

Effect The abysium sentinel alerts its owner of an intruder, either with a mental or audible alarm, depending on established orders. The mental alarm has a range of 1 mile.
HZiqpXLNb8BDBGs6.name: Security Alert

Na7ixzfKQvB0suSv.description: Until the next time it acts, the abysium sentinel appears to be the head of a statue it's perched atop. It has an automatic result of 58 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as nothing more than a statue's head.
Na7ixzfKQvB0suSv.name: Statue's Head

Abysium Sentinel.name: Abysium Sentinel

Adamantine Sentinel.description:
This sentinel has a canine skull adorned with patterns of constellations.

Thassilonian sentinels are crafted in the shapes of skulls or heads.

Sentinel Sets

Thassilonian sentinels were typically carved from marble, ivory, and bronze, easily blending in with most statues. Rarer sentinels carved from wood, coral, and skymetals were often commissioned in sets alongside matching statues to ensure seamless fits or were carefully sculpted for display alone.

e6vs2l4YORXfw19v.description: Until the next time it acts, the adamantine sentinel appears to be the head of a statue it's perched atop. It has an automatic result of 53 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as nothing more than a statue's head.
e6vs2l4YORXfw19v.name: Statue's Head

vuTLaoY3oRoeTqQ7.description:
Trigger The adamantine sentinel becomes aware of an unfamiliar creature

Effect The adamantine sentinel alerts its owner of an intruder, either with a mental or audible alarm, depending on established orders. The mental alarm has a range of 1 mile.
vuTLaoY3oRoeTqQ7.name: Security Alert

Adamantine Sentinel.name: Adamantine Sentinel

91O5NIAKldRwIV2M.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If Aethusa's next action is to cast a cantrip or a spell that is 6th rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).
91O5NIAKldRwIV2M.name: Quickened Casting

LicbinzIkNMOJYUi.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Aethusa accesses what she believes to be the memories of two previous runelords. For the next 1 minute, whenever Aethusa makes a skill check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge}, she rolls three times and uses the highest result.
LicbinzIkNMOJYUi.name: Past Lives

hjrL2H6KtUKNlnTJ.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger Aethusa Casts a Spell of 6th rank or higher

Effect Aethusa momentarily infuses her preferred form of sin magic (sloth) with the power of either gluttony or greed magic. The triggering spell slot is expended, but instead of the spell's normal effects, Aethusa casts either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]{Cursed Metamorphosis} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.fd31tAHSSGXyOxW6]{Vampiric Exsanguination} at 6th rank.
hjrL2H6KtUKNlnTJ.name: Adaptive Rune Magic

jifO2Dode8GJDyzH.description: If a reaction would disrupt Aethusa's spellcasting action, she attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.
jifO2Dode8GJDyzH.name: Steady Spellcasting

Aethusa's Prison.description: A roiling sphere of chromatic energy floats above a pedestal marked with arcane symbols.
Aethusa's Prison.hazardDisable: @Check[nature|dc:42] (legendary) or @Check[crafting|dc:45] (master) to remove an immunity the prison currently has to one of the following damage types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire (this effect lasts until the prison uses its Energy Immunity reaction to regain that immunity); @Check[arcana|dc:42] (master) to fortify the pedestal's containment runes, preventing the prison from using its Chromatic Eruption action for 1 round and causing it to suffer feedback that inflicts @Damage[20[untyped]] damage (this damage bypasses the prison's hardness and immunities); @Check[thievery|dc:42] (master) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th rank; counteract DC 34) to suppress the pedestal's containment runes for 1 round, preventing the prison from using its Self-Repair action and causing it to suffer feedback that inflicts @Damage[20[untyped]] damage (this damage bypasses the prison's hardness and immunities). Unlike most hazards, Aethusa's prison can't be disabled, but it can be destroyed by reducing it to 0 Hit Points.
Aethusa's Prison.hazardReset: The trap deactivates and then resets automatically when it repairs to its maximum Hit Points.
Aethusa's Prison.hazardRoutine: (2 actions) The prison uses its first action to Self-Repair. If the hazard has less than its maximum Hit Points, it then uses its Chromatic Eruption action.
Aethusa's Prison.name: Aethusa's Prison

Ancient One.description:
In the Dimension of Time, creatures clad in tattered robes float between encapsulated bubbles of still, captured moments, untethered to any other place, unspeaking and unseeing. The few mortals to meet these enigmatic, faceless creatures have never known them to identify by any name other than the ancient ones, seemingly holding no identity (or no identity they wish to share) beyond their relationship with time.

The ancients profess to have always existed in the Dimension of Time, and for time to have always existed in the Great Beyond. Most reside in Stethelos, the storied city at the center of time, though they're also found wandering the Void, crossing the strangest corners of the Maelstrom where it lies between other planes, and occasionally, venturing into dark corners of the Universe. They serve at the will of Tawil at'Umr, the All in One and the One in All, an avatar of Yog-Sothoth lurking deep within time as Stethelos's caretaker. Though the ancient ones resemble their master in stature and attire, and though none would describe Tawil at'Umr as anything other than ancient in origin, most scholars consider "ancient one" a classification of its own separate from that of Great Old One, and Tawil at'Umr is definitively counted among the Great Old Ones by all who know it.

Where Yog-Sothoth is an embodiment of all space and time, an entity who concerns himself with guarding cosmic secrets, the ancient ones are philosophers and mystics seeking ever more enlightenment. They search, have searched, and will search across time indefinitely and, having found entropy and disorder, conclude this to be the Great Beyond's ultimate purpose. When a new creature dawns, it's pristine and whole—perfectly ordered—for but a single moment before it can be eroded by Pharasma's poison, accumulating decay, change, and chaos, until finally it reaches its ending, when time leaves a twilight creature broken and gone. Law and chaos, the ancient ones believe, aren't opposing or even separate forces, but a single expression of reality viewed from two angles, different from each other only in time.

How Old is Time?

Lying in parallel with the Great Beyond with a presence felt on nearly every plane, from the Inner Sphere to the Outer Rifts, the Dimension of Time holds too many secrets for a reality so seemingly omnipresent. Can a world truly be said to begin before time is there to start? Scholars say Pharasma is the oldest being in the Great Beyond, a survivor of some previous multiverse's collapse, but does the Lady of Graves predate time, or did she bring the Dimension of Time with her so history could begin everything anew?

Into the Dimension of Time

The Dimension of Time is one of the most difficult and complex realms in the Great Beyond to travel to, with restrictions on its access limiting all but the most powerful of planar travelers from visiting it. At the GM's discretion, though, items looted from an ancient one, or even just fragments torn from their robes, could function as the planar key needed to allow a PC to use interplanar teleport to access the Dimension of Time.

4uJJ9K5QDktQ8QqF.description: Creatures the ancient one affected with a mental effect or communicated with telepathically within the last round can hijack the ancient one's telepathic connection; they automatically ignore the ancient one's immunity to auditory, emotion, and visual effects until the end of their current turn. They can additionally spend 1 Mythic Point as a free action to reach through the connection to manipulate the ancient one's mind, ignoring the ancient one's mythic resilience on Will saving throws.
4uJJ9K5QDktQ8QqF.name: The Connection Cuts Both Ways

57RyeZtjMTcVXQNk.description: An ancient one doesn't breathe and is immune to effects that require breathing (such as inhaled poisons).
57RyeZtjMTcVXQNk.name: No Breath

6D8HqMFUM6g3Y14w.description: Whenever a creature targets the ancient one with a mental effect, that creature takes @Damage[6d8[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:39|basic] save). On a critical failure, the creature also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.
6D8HqMFUM6g3Y14w.name: Otherworldly Mind

F0ScmL6aiNkctoB7.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement within 10 feet of the ancient one

Effect Ancient ones exist spread out across infinite times and places simultaneously and can shift themselves through their catalog of potentialities. The ancient one teleports themself and the triggering creature into empty squares within 10 feet of their respective positions, though the triggering creature can't be moved into hazardous terrain or to a place it can't stand. An unwilling creature can resist the teleportation with a successful @Check[will|dc:42] save.
F0ScmL6aiNkctoB7.name: Unified Timeline

FYCA8aWmh4AdsdgY.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The ancient one ends one condition affecting them.
FYCA8aWmh4AdsdgY.name: Remove a Condition

KmnzLP6lHMlo9oat.description: The ancient one can predict the presence of a creature through supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance and builds a perception of reality from this information, allowing them to "see" as a precise sense in the listed range. Invisible creatures are visible to them, but veil of privacy prevents a creature from being detected via entropy sense automatically (without a counteract check).
KmnzLP6lHMlo9oat.name: Entropy Sense

QD3kQUdoyUoCmc0o.description: Time and entropy end all things, even the undead. When the ancient one's Strikes hit a creature with void healing, they deal vitality damage instead of void damage. The ancient one can't use their Strikes to restore Hit Points to living or undead creatures.
QD3kQUdoyUoCmc0o.name: Dismantle All Life

U8QQvvT3DBUmhO6X.description:
Cost all of the Ancient One's Mythic Points

Trigger The ancient one would die and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect The ancient one remains conscious, and recovers 50% of their maximum Hit Points.
U8QQvvT3DBUmhO6X.name: Undying Myth

Ukqna71c9zIfLg06.description:
The ancient one speaks without sound, contacting a creature within 120 feet telepathically to send out waves of visions that fill its mind with fragmented thoughts, unrealized chaos, and futures where its choices are never consequential. The target attempts a @Check[will|dc:42] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is disoriented by the visions and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The target is overwhelmed by the visions and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}.
Ukqna71c9zIfLg06.name: Vision of Lost Meaning

YD2hUTxEE6HfICVs.description: The creature treats its saving throws with the associated save as one degree of success better than it rolled. This is not cumulative with other effects that change their degree of success, like the incapacitation trait (except for rolling a natural 1 or 20). Each time the monster gains mythic resilience, choose one save. The ability should apply to the creature's highest saves first.
YD2hUTxEE6HfICVs.name: Mythic Resilience (Will)

ZUgYOmlfCEXWSI9b.description: The ancient one instantly transports themself and any items they're wearing and holding from their current space to an unoccupied space within 100 feet they can see. Once per turn, the ancient one can spend 1 Mythic Point to slither between worlds as a free action on their turn.
ZUgYOmlfCEXWSI9b.name: Slither Between Worlds

aGMAguEtcn7YJOST.description:
Requirements You have a planar key for the destination plane, used as a locus

You and your allies traverse the barriers between planes of existence. The targets move to another plane, such as the Plane of Fire, the Netherworld, or the Outer Rifts. You must know the destination plane exists and use a magic planar key created from material from that plane as a locus for the spell. While the planar keys for most prominent planes are uncommon, just like the spell interplanar teleport, more obscure planes and demiplanes often have rare or possibly even unique planar keys.

The spell is highly imprecise, and you appear 1d20×25 miles from the last place one of the targets (of your choice) was located the last time that target traveled to the plane. If it's the first time traveling to a particular plane for all targets, you appear at a random location on the plane. Interplanar teleport doesn't provide a means of return travel, though casting interplanar teleport again allows you to return to your previous plane unless there are extenuating circumstances.
aGMAguEtcn7YJOST.name: Interplanar Teleport (At Will, Self Only)

qXHaprIwUHCk5FuN.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Trigger The ancient one fails a check

Effect The ancient one rerolls the check.
qXHaprIwUHCk5FuN.name: Reroll

vu93ggI1AAdtn7fG.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The ancient one regains an expended spell.
vu93ggI1AAdtn7fG.name: Recharge

Ancient One.name: Ancient One

Animate Nightmare.description:
Whereas animate dreams form from the fears of specific individuals, animate nightmares are spawned by the terrors that beset civilizations. An animate nightmare's appearance depends on the type of fear that created it, but, like fears, result in similar forms.

Emigrants From Dreams

Animate nightmares often haunt the ruins of the civilization that birthed them. Others are drawn to Jandelay, the enigmatic demiplane where the fragments of dead worlds are preserved for all eternity, or to Abaddon, where apocalyptic nihilism is the rule. These latter nightmares might stay close to their "parent" civilizations, while others wander the broken avenues of multiple worlds, feeding off the traces of fear that linger in those places.

5LCoZdHExWKhGMfl.description:
An animate nightmare embodies one societal fear, chosen from the following options. Depending on the choice, the animate nightmare gains one additional 8th-rank occult innate spell, as listed below.

Disaster The animate nightmare appears as a person or creature who's suffered devastating wounds from a calamity—horrific burns, crushed and broken limbs, impalements from wind-tossed debris, and the like. It gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0XP2XOxT9VSiXFDr]{Phantasmal Calamity} at 8th rank.

Disorder The animate nightmare looks like a distorted parody of a commonplace person with unnaturally long limbs, a twisted visage, and a scratching shrill voice. It gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LiGbewa9pO0yjbsY]{Confusion} at 8th rank.

Famine The animate nightmare appears as a humanoid carrion bird or other bestial scavenger (such as a jackal or a fly) on the brink of death from starvation. It gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.fd31tAHSSGXyOxW6]{Vampiric Exsanguination} at 8th rank.

Plague The animate nightmare is shaped like a tangle of diseased bodies animated into hideous life that might have just crawled out of a mass grave. It gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.MS60WhVifb45qORJ]{Spiritual Epidemic} at 8th rank.
5LCoZdHExWKhGMfl.name: Apocalyptic Embodiment

9g0ozIReEGhutb10.description:
Requirements The animate nightmare's previous action was a nightmare tendril Strike against a creature

Effect The animate nightmare's touch lingers and infuses the mind of the creature it just attempted to Strike. The creature takes @Damage[8d6[persistent,mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:38|basic] save). If the creature is already taking persistent mental damage from Panicking Touch, it must instead succeed at a @Check[will|dc:38] save or endure a different effect based on the animate nightmare's apocalyptic embodiment; this additional effect lasts as long as the persistent mental damage lasts.

Disaster The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and can't reduce its frightened condition.

Disorder The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}.

Famine The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Plague The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.
9g0ozIReEGhutb10.name: Panicking Touch

Animate Nightmare.name: Animate Nightmare
Animate Nightmare.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Animus of Longing.description: Three pitchers pour water in an endless cascade, each decorated with a symbol of fertility, fecundity, and desire. The pitchers never empty, and the fountain below never overflows; the entire thing flickers with eerie red energy.
Animus of Longing.hazardDisable: @Check[arcana|dc:50] (legendary) or @Check[society|dc:50] (legendary) to decipher the symbols and runes scribed across on the runewell and pinpoint which runes can be used to deactivate it, @Check[thievery|dc:53] (legendary) to temporarily disrupt the anima focus's connection to the Eye of Desire or to destroy a phantom of desire; three total successes are required to disable the hazard (destroying a phantom of desire counts as a single success)
Animus of Longing.hazardReset: The animus of longing deactivates as soon as no foes remain in the atrium, then immediately resets.
Animus of Longing.hazardRoutine: (1 action) On its turn, the animus of longing sustains the three phantoms of desire. The three creatures each take their turn.
Animus of Longing.name: Animus of Longing

Apocalypse Stormfront.description: An endless void stretches in all directions. Visions of Golarion's destruction roll like storm clouds across the space.
Apocalypse Stormfront.hazardDisable: @Check[acrobatics|dc:47] to Fly through the space without becoming stuck in the webs, @Check[athletics|dc:50] to Climb the webs and make progress forward through the infinite, @Check[nature|dc:47] or @Check[occultism|dc:47] or @Check[arcana|dc:50] or @Check[religion|dc:50] (legendary) to collapse the extradimensional space, or @Check[perception|dc:52] to peer through the visions of Golarion to notice discrepancies that help keep the overwhelming despair from setting in; six successes disables the hazard, causing it to vanish forever and shunting all creatures to Liralarue's Prison.
Apocalypse Stormfront.hazardReset: The hazard resets automatically once no creatures are in the area.
Apocalypse Stormfront.hazardRoutine:
(1 action) (arcane, emotion, illusion, mental) A stormfront filled with illusory scenes of Golarion's destruction rolls through the extradimensional space. Each creature in the hazard's area takes @Damage[6d12[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:42|basic|traits:arcane,emotion,illusion,mental] save). On a failed save, a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2} on a critical failure). A PC reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage is shunted back into area C7.

A creature that takes damage while Climbing the webs must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] save or fall. A creature can try to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} (@Check[reflex|dc:40]). On a success, they lose one success they've earned to escape the hazard but otherwise arrest their fall. On a failure, they plummet into the void, losing all Athletics successes they've earned to escape the hazard. Each round on their turn, the character can try to Grab an Edge again, but each time they fail to do so, the party must earn an additional success to escape the hazard. Characters who fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} or repeatedly fail to Grab an Edge might effectively become lost in the void, though once the nightmare hazard is disabled, they appear along with the rest of the PCs in Liralarue's Prison.
Apocalypse Stormfront.name: Apocalypse Stormfront

9ZexU5G8vR01fndt.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Areelu engages a creature she has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in an embrace or other act of passion, creating an opportunity for a cloud of locusts to enter the creature's body. The creature takes @Damage[5d6[persistent,bleed]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for as long as they remain sickened.
9ZexU5G8vR01fndt.name: Kiss of Locusts

BZDOjgPsiEVD7Wrw.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Trigger Areelu fails a check

Effect Areelu rerolls the check.
BZDOjgPsiEVD7Wrw.name: Reroll

FdLVtwbtDsrkOnm0.description: You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion, morph or polymorph effect in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the polymorph spell).
FdLVtwbtDsrkOnm0.name: Truesight (Constant)

RP6a6mqRkK2PV9dj.description: Areelu attempts to [[/act grapple skill=deception]] a creature using her Deception bonus instead of Athletics. If the creature is willing, Areelu automatically succeeds.
RP6a6mqRkK2PV9dj.name: Embrace

RvfwtSnkEp32kjlQ.description: The creature treats its saving throws with the associated save as one degree of success better than it rolled. This is not cumulative with other effects that change their degree of success, like the incapacitation trait (except for rolling a natural 1 or 20). Each time the monster gains mythic resilience, choose one save. The ability should apply to the creature's highest saves first.
RvfwtSnkEp32kjlQ.name: Mythic Resilience (Fortitude and Will)

SgChpso6dVmgp5Xl.description: Areelu Vorlesh's apotheosis into a demon has made her vulnerable to rejection like a succubus. When Areelu fails a Deception check to Embrace or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie}, or when a creature succeeds at its save against her mental spells or abilities, she takes @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage. For 1 hour after causing mental damage to Areelu in this way, the creature can deal @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage to her with a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} action incorporating its rejection.
SgChpso6dVmgp5Xl.name: Rejection Vulnerability

drwtv7iolRzQtwXr.description:
Cost all of Areelu's Mythic Points

Trigger Areelu would die and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect Areelu remains standing and conscious and recovers @Damage[200[healing]] Hit Points.
drwtv7iolRzQtwXr.name: Undying Myth

fQXLv7ASwrte0IvJ.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Areelu regains an expended spell slot.
fQXLv7ASwrte0IvJ.name: Recharge

hI4wwfshEfm6Azmi.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Areelu ends one condition affecting her.
hI4wwfshEfm6Azmi.name: Remove a Condition

2FCqsVtRwzBf8XGC.description: Ayavah makes Crafting checks associated with sculpture at legendary proficiency. If she rolls a failure on a Crafting check involving sculpture, she gets a success instead.
2FCqsVtRwzBf8XGC.name: Legendary Sculptor

TKcvQ3hcNsXZmwwi.description: When Ayavah Refocuses, she completely fills her focus pool.
TKcvQ3hcNsXZmwwi.name: Bloodline Focus

V4YubRcmsYVSkYbp.description: When Ayavah casts a bloodline spell using a Focus Point or one of the following spells: blister, disintegrate, divine wrath, enlarge, fear, or slow, she can choose to either give a target a –1 status penalty to AC for 1 round or gain a +2 status bonus to Intimidation checks for 1 round.
V4YubRcmsYVSkYbp.name: Corruption of Sin

ZT12qgLEOgKNHLcg.description: If the next action Ayavah takes is to Cast a Spell that has a range, increase that spell's range by 30 feet.
ZT12qgLEOgKNHLcg.name: Reach Spell

Ayavah.name: Ayavah
Ayavah.npcAllSaves: +1 status to saves against spells and magic effects

Baolen.description: A kraken is an enormous, squid-like leviathan with a cruel intelligence. It hunts ships, whales, and heroes alike. The hatred and envy krakens hold for alghollthus, their rivals, has led many krakens to make their lairs in sunken cities, where they can sift through ancient lore and uncover long-lost arcane secrets.

00HuCJEgA6cYLFaF.description: The kraken moves through the water up to 280 feet in a straight line without triggering reactions.
00HuCJEgA6cYLFaF.name: Jet

95k2q11INtOhFqCd.description:
The kraken makes two Strikes with two different arms or tentacles, each limb targeting a different creature. Double Attack counts as two attacks toward the kraken's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks are made.

If the kraken subsequently uses the Grab action, it Grabs any number of creatures it hit with Double Attack.
95k2q11INtOhFqCd.name: Double Attack

DtiXNG3ROuAaBhN3.description:
@Damage[(2d10+17)[bludgeoning]], @Check[fortitude|dc:40|basic]. On a failed save, a creature that is holding its breath loses [[/gmr 1d4 #Lost rounds of air from Constrict]]{1d4 rounds} worth of air.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

EkSi5KM6hOWO5WxD.description:
Baolen is immune to this poison

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:40]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[5d6[mental]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}, and the target is exposed to the curse of flawed history (1 round)
EkSi5KM6hOWO5WxD.name: Retrocognitive Ink

QDGHfSYTFUEtVnOd.description:
Cost all of Baolen's Mythic Points

Trigger Baolen would die and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect Baolen remains standing and conscious, and recovers 50% of his maximum Hit Points.
QDGHfSYTFUEtVnOd.name: Undying Myth

QVWyf8FH4ZFhAb85.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Baolen regains an expended spell.
QVWyf8FH4ZFhAb85.name: Recharge

h0WHBV57PWi9FCKG.description:
Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:37]

Effect The target struggles to differentiate between alternate histories and how the past truly occurred. The creature takes a –2 status penalty to checks made to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} (or a –4 penalty on a critical failure). This curse has an unlimited duration.
h0WHBV57PWi9FCKG.name: Curse of Flawed History

heW1rCJfQ2KMmuqd.description:
The kraken releases a cloud of black, venomous ink in an @Template[emanation|distance:80]. This cloud has no effect outside water.

Creatures inside the ink cloud are exposed to retrocognitive ink poison and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} while inside the cloud.

The kraken can't use Ink Cloud again for [[/br 2d6 #Recharge Ink Cloud]]{2d6 rounds}, and the cloud dissipates after 1 minute.
heW1rCJfQ2KMmuqd.name: Ink Cloud

on5KfUlSOl4j5TOa.description: Baolen's mythic resilience doesn't apply to Will saving throws he makes against the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} condition. If Baolen starts his turn confused, he takes @Damage[6d10[mental]] damage.
on5KfUlSOl4j5TOa.name: Susceptible to Confusion

ri68Bk0TcV1k9lqS.description:
A kraken reshapes the weather within 2 miles of it, with the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XkDCzMIyc0YOjw05]{Control Weather} ritual centered on the kraken and based on its emotional state, at the GM's discretion. If the kraken dies, the weather returns to normal immediately.

Baolen is currently content in his place as an object of worship, though, so the surrounding weather remains calm.
ri68Bk0TcV1k9lqS.name: Altered Weather

Baolen.name: Baolen

365vAIPotQcDxghT.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet casts a spell with the air, earth, fire, metal, water, wood, or void trait that deals damage

Effect Belimarius seethes with jealousy at another spellcaster's magical accomplishments. She regains @Damage[25[healing]] Hit Points, and until the end of her next turn, Belimarius's spell DC increases by 1, and her spell attacks gain a +1 circumstance bonus.
365vAIPotQcDxghT.name: Never Enough

BCETM19EwnsPCcI8.description:
Trigger Belimarius is the target of a spell she's aware of

Effect Belimarius attempts to counteract the triggering spell with a [[/r 1d20+35 #Counteract]]{+35} counteract modifier and a counteract rank of 10. If the triggering spell would be counteracted, it instead continues with the caster as a target instead of Belimarius.
BCETM19EwnsPCcI8.name: Spell Riposte

CVNXmpkf2BEkTgdo.description:
The target can understand all words regardless of language and also speak the languages of other creatures. When in a mixed group of creatures, each time the target speaks, it can choose a creature and speak in a language that creature understands, even if the target doesn't know what language that is.

Heightened (7th) The duration is 8 hours.
CVNXmpkf2BEkTgdo.name: Truespeech (Constant)

GsepbWCp9qf2rBqR.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2BV2yYPfVJ5zirZt]{Mountain Resilience}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated rank.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of the spell at the listed rank.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.
GsepbWCp9qf2rBqR.name: Wand of Mountain Resilience (Rank 4)

IwLvC3UK5kz3srY6.description:

Trigger Belimarius would die and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect Belimarius remains standing and conscious, and recovers @Damage[175[healing]] Hit Points.
IwLvC3UK5kz3srY6.name: Undying Myth

JIldJyj0KQ2zoos1.description:
The target can soar through the air, gaining a fly Speed equal to its Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.MuRBCiZn5IKeaoxi]{Spell Effect: Fly}

Heightened (7th) The duration increases to 1 hour.
JIldJyj0KQ2zoos1.name: Fly (Constant)

P86jZNWp9xxGfny2.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Belimarius ends one condition affecting her.
P86jZNWp9xxGfny2.name: Remove a Condition

X2ewevqnmtDcEqC4.description:
Requirements Belimarius has a free hand and isn't holding her Invidious Halberd

Effect Belimarius calls her Invidious Halberd, and it appears in one of her hands.
X2ewevqnmtDcEqC4.name: Manifest Halberd

YyuQJwqXJXvt3VDX.description:
Trigger Belimarius begins her turn

Requirements Belimarius has the warshard of Gorum held in a hand

Effect While its mythic potential and divine power has largely been used to transform the Eye of Desire and the Runewell of Lust into the forms described in Chapter 1 to enable her imminent mythic ascension, enough power remains within to generate one final effect. With a quick motion, Belimarius crushes the mostly depleted warshard she holds in her hand, destroying it and causing red rain to cascade down around her in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:120] (which easily fills the entirety of the Eye of Desire). Allies in this area (Belimarius and her two knights of malice) become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 minute but can use the extra action only to Strike with a melee weapon. Foes in the area (including the PCs) must attempt a @Check[will|dc:41] save.

Critical Success The creature absorbs some of Gorum's legacy and gains 1 Mythic Point that they must spend before the end of their next turn.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is overwhelmed with despair at Gorum's death and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} with despair at Gorum's death. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can attempt a @Check[will|dc:41] save to end the effect, with the DC lowered by 2 each subsequent round.
YyuQJwqXJXvt3VDX.name: Sacrifice Warshard

g9ov9wGIpQpP7yrf.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Belimarius regains an expended spell.
g9ov9wGIpQpP7yrf.name: Recharge

i1ophnhiJ5mni9oH.description: You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion, morph or polymorph effect in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the polymorph spell).
i1ophnhiJ5mni9oH.name: Truesight (Constant)

iBKWg6yZIjBElNPM.description:
By imposing your will upon the water, you can raise or lower the level of water in the chosen area by 10 feet. Creatures that have the water trait and that are in the area when you Cast the Spell must attempt a Fortitude save, with the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WsUwpfmhKrKwoIe3]{Slow} spell.

Area 50 feet long by 50 feet wide
iBKWg6yZIjBElNPM.name: Control Water

kOfe06grGmIZkTom.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If Runelord Belimarius's next action is to cast a cantrip or spell of 8th rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).
kOfe06grGmIZkTom.name: Quickened Casting

lH315Wih2JqSaQZ6.description: Belimarius is immortal and immune to the negative effects of aging and disease, and she's resistant to mental damage. Her immortality doesn't prevent her death from other means.
lH315Wih2JqSaQZ6.name: Immortality

upimvPnCDeAcMg64.description:
Powerful wards hide a creature from magic that would spy on it or affect its mind. The target gains a +4 status bonus to saves against mental effects. Hidden mind attempts to counteract any detection, revelation, and scrying effects as if its spell rank were 1 higher than its actual rank. On a success, the effect functions normally except that it detects nothing about the target and its possessions. For instance, detect magic would still detect other magic in the area, but not any magic on the target.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.DBaMtFHRPEg1JeLs]{Spell Effect: Hidden Mind}
upimvPnCDeAcMg64.name: Hidden Mind (Constant)

y7ZXsoccnjoYiTO5.description:
Trigger Runelord Belimarius reduces a mythic creature to 0 HP, or the PCs take more than 24 hours to confront her after securing entrance to the Eye of Desire

Effect The warshard Belimarius has fused with the Runewell of Lust flares with a sudden flash of blood-red light. Belimarius gains the mythic trait, 3 Mythic Points, and her Mythic Powers. In time, she might develop additional mythic powers, but only if she survives her encounter with the PCs.
y7ZXsoccnjoYiTO5.name: Mythic Ascension

Belimarius.name: Belimarius
Belimarius.npcAllSaves: +1 status vs. magical effects, +4 status vs. mental effects HP 350; Immunities aging, disease; R

Bittersweet Mask.description: The many iron bars of this iron mask fits tightly around Javownir's head and snout, looking almost as if it was built in place to conform specifically to the shape of his skull with no apparent latch or hinge for it to be removed.
Bittersweet Mask.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:45] (expert) twice to find the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} latches, @Check[athletics|dc:48] (master) to wrench the mask open quickly enough to prevent it from triggering before it's destroyed, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th-rank; counteract DC 35), or automatic with Spleen's key
Bittersweet Mask.hazardReset: The mask resets automatically at the start of the round after it is triggered.
Bittersweet Mask.name: Bittersweet Mask

AtSxBEaHS4ljnAyv.description:
A Bittersweet Sister adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]{Interplanar Teleport}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r784cIz17eWujtQj]{Scrying}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PHVHBbdHeQRfjLmE]{Spirit Blast} to her coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

H3pa17KySBkdeqib.description:
A moon hag in an area illuminated by moonlight gains a +2 status bonus to AC and initiative rolls. In the light of a full moon, they're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened}, and can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike. If the moon hag has a fly Speed, they can use the extra action to Fly as well.

Any time they're outside of the oubliette or in area C7 they are in moonlight.
H3pa17KySBkdeqib.name: Moonlight's Kiss

HHf3xli4cWMiMJui.description:
The moon hag can take on the appearance of any Medium humanoid woman. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

YKkmQnZZiXcOOYb8.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The moon hag teleports themself and any items they're wearing and holding to another space within 30 feet, or 60 feet if they're in moonlight. They then gain a 25-foot fly Speed until the end of their next turn. If the moon hag is in the air when the effect ends, they float to the ground, taking no falling damage.

Any time they're outside of the oubliette or in area C7 they are in moonlight.
YKkmQnZZiXcOOYb8.name: Ride the Moonbeams

yBpXyahw41IRnTwr.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The moon hag howls a series of dreadful, apocalyptic predictions at a single creature within 30 feet, shattering its perceptions of reality. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save and takes a –2 circumstance penalty to the save if it can see the moon. On a failure, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} on a critical failure) until the curse is removed. Regardless of the outcome, the creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.
yBpXyahw41IRnTwr.name: Dreadful Prediction

Cataclysmic Planar Rift.description: This apocalypse represents the effects of numerous planar rifts forming and exploding in a region, with the risk of the planar fabric being compromised enough to tear a city-sized (if not larger) hole in reality. These rifts are likely to eject inhabitants of the other plane into the Universe, as well as serve as gateways for furious defenders to pour through to punish anyone they think might be responsible for the problem. Any additional encounters that result from these incursions should award XP as normal for encounters of their difficulty. While the rifts are likely to all lead to the same plane, particularly far-reaching disruptions might create gateways to multiple planes at once, with each rift spewing forth its own defenders. These groups would each have their own aims and agendas, clashing, collaborating, or causing chaos wherever they go.
Cataclysmic Planar Rift.hazardDisable: DC 42 Lore (expert) with the plane's Lore skill, @Check[arcana|dc:45] (master), @Check[nature|dc:45] (master), @Check[occultism|dc:45] (master), @Check[religion|dc:45] (master) or @Check[performance|dc:48] (legendary) to perform a planar stabilization rite to minimize the damage
Cataclysmic Planar Rift.hazardRoutine:
(1+ hours, @Check[flat|dc:18]) Rifts detonate with raw planar essence. As the hazard progresses, the ruptures grow more frequent until they merge together into a gaping portal (this final stage might be prevented with good fortune or successful efforts to Prepare). Ruptures occur once per 10 minutes for the first hour and once per minute for the second hour. The frequency with which each unprepared creature in the area is hit by a rupture depends upon their proximity to the hazard's epicenter. If the hazard proceeds into a third hour, all creatures and objects in the area take the hazard's damage one final time before being swallowed up by the burgeoning portal and deposited on the other plane.

The planar explosions deal 2d12+18 damage, with a DC 42 basic saving throw, and inflict a condition on a failed saving throw. The damage type, saving throw type, condition, and condition duration depend upon the exploding plane, as detailed in the table below.

Cataclysmic Planar Rift.name: Cataclysmic Planar Rift

Cataclysmic Planar Rift (Escalation).description: This apocalypse represents the effects of numerous planar rifts forming and exploding in a region, with the risk of the planar fabric being compromised enough to tear a city-sized (if not larger) hole in reality. These rifts are likely to eject inhabitants of the other plane into the Universe, as well as serve as gateways for furious defenders to pour through to punish anyone they think might be responsible for the problem. Any additional encounters that result from these incursions should award XP as normal for encounters of their difficulty. While the rifts are likely to all lead to the same plane, particularly far-reaching disruptions might create gateways to multiple planes at once, with each rift spewing forth its own defenders. These groups would each have their own aims and agendas, clashing, collaborating, or causing chaos wherever they go.
Cataclysmic Planar Rift (Escalation).hazardDisable: DC 45 Lore (expert) with the plane's Lore skill, @Check[arcana|dc:48] (master), @Check[nature|dc:48] (master), @Check[occultism|dc:48] (master), @Check[religion|dc:48] (master) or @Check[performance|dc:51] (legendary) to perform a planar stabilization rite to minimize the damage
Cataclysmic Planar Rift (Escalation).hazardRoutine:
(1+ hours, @Check[flat|dc:18]) Rifts detonate with raw planar essence. As the hazard progresses, the ruptures grow more frequent until they merge together into a gaping portal (this final stage might be prevented with good fortune or successful efforts to Prepare). Ruptures occur once per 10 minutes for the first hour and once per minute for the second hour. The frequency with which each unprepared creature in the area is hit by a rupture depends upon their proximity to the hazard's epicenter. If the hazard proceeds into a third hour, all creatures and objects in the area take the hazard's damage one final time before being swallowed up by the burgeoning portal and deposited on the other plane.

The planar explosions deal 3d12+18 damage, with a DC 45 basic saving throw, and inflict a condition on a failed saving throw. The damage type, saving throw type, condition, and condition duration depend upon the exploding plane, as detailed in the table below.

Clockwork Whale.description:
Out of all ancient Azlant's clockwork creations, clockwork whales are perhaps the most impressive—or at least the among the largest. Shaped like a bizarre fusion of a shark and an enormous toothed whale, clockwork whales patrolled the shipping lanes around Azlant for centuries before Earthfall shattered the continent, sinking it beneath the waves. Outfitted with complex programming and sensory arrays that allowed for near-perfect navigation, clockwork whales are thought to have been used primarily for securing new and safe nautical routes, although some served as naval transports during Azlant's cold war with the empire's ancient enemy, the alghollthus.

With jaws nearly a third of its entire length, a clockwork whale's bite can slice neatly through smaller seafaring vessels and inflict devastating damage to the hulls of larger ones. These gears swiftly cut those swallowed whole into fragments that are then slowly washed away by the flow of water through tiny gaps in the creature's body.

Winding Up

Most clockworks must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute, after which the clockwork remains operational for the listed amount of time. As long as a clockwork whale spends at least a minute every day swimming, its self-winding ability allows it to continue operating without needing this step. A clockwork whale that can't swim (as might be the case after a clockwork whale becomes beached) usually remains operational for approximately 8 hours before it completely winds down.

Gt2FhL34NkJiFyoF.description: While in a large body of water, the clockwork whale treats a failure at Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.fJImDBQfqfjKJOhk]{Sense Direction} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} as a success.
Gt2FhL34NkJiFyoF.name: Astounding Orienteering

Tk9Sz3VTu0JXJPV8.description: A clockwork whale winds itself through the act of swimming, and as long as it spends at least a minute a day swimming, it gains 24 hours of operational time. A creature can still attempt a @Check[thievery|dc:36] check to Disable a Device to cause the clockwork whale to lose 1 hour of operational time (or 2 hours on a critical success).
Tk9Sz3VTu0JXJPV8.name: Self-Winding

U90Zt8x3skhxELuL.description: The whale creates a vocalization that can be heard up to 1 mile away, or 10 miles away underwater. Creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] (or a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60] underwater) take @Damage[15d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:38|basic] save). On a failed save, a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure). The whale can't use Gearsong again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Gearsong]]{1d4 rounds}.
U90Zt8x3skhxELuL.name: Gearsong

hXhPTMLLQK79yFj0.description: The clockwork whale can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater.
hXhPTMLLQK79yFj0.name: Aquatic Echolocation

Clockwork Whale.name: Clockwork Whale

Colossus Rampage.description: Monsters of titanic proportions awaken and stampede across the land, crushing everything in their wake. These might be a group of battling kaiju, an army of titanic constructs, or another onslaught of oversized creatures. This hazard works best when combined with combat against one or more massive monsters. These creatures might notice the PCs' strength and decide to get rid of them before the PCs have a chance to interfere with their onslaught.
Colossus Rampage.hazardDisable: @Check[crafting|dc:48] (master) or Thievery (master) to lay traps to hamper the approaching rampage; DC 50 (master) skill check with a skill typically used to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about the creature's type to make targeted preparations (DC 46 if it's a Lore skill); or @Check[Warfare Lore|dc:46] (master), @Check[intimidation|dc:48] (master), or @Check[diplomacy|dc:50] (master) to rally nearby troops to prepare for battle
Colossus Rampage.hazardRoutine:
(10+ minutes, @Check[flat|dc:15]) The colossus rampage affects the entire area, but whether or not the affected area remains static, moves, expands, or otherwise changes is left to you to determine as the story needs. At the start of each minute, unprepared creatures in the area take @Damage[(3d10+10)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:47|basic] save). A creature that fails the save is jostled enough that they're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for that minute, while a creature that critically fails is pinned under fallen debris and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until they [[/act escape dc=47]].

Two additional effects, based on the nature of the creatures and the battlefield, take place during that minute. Roll [[/gmr 1d10]] for each to determine on which round during that minute each effect takes place (rerolling duplicate rounds). You can create alternative abilities to better fit the nature of the creatures in the stampede, but in general, consider selecting one ability that imposes a condition or battlefield effect and one that deals damage. Note that these effects can affect prepared and unprepared creatures in the area, but when a prepared creature attempts a save against any of these effects, they increase their result by one degree of success.
Colossus Rampage.name: Colossus Rampage

Commander Yrasthura.description:
Rune giants are tyrants among their own kind, given power to command and magically control other giants. They once served even more powerful masters—potent wizards known as runelords—and in so doing, commanded entire armies of giants in service to the runelords' empires.

In the eons since these empires collapsed, rune giants have persisted, though to the outside world they're little more than fabled horrors. Rune giants usually dwell in the most remote and rugged of towering mountain ranges, but they can also be found in immense ruins atop lost islands, glacial valleys, or even more remote or magical regions.

Dozens of runes decorate rune giants' striking charcoal flesh. They are towering creatures, averaging at 40 feet in height and weighing 25,000 pounds.

Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They vary widely but are united in their hunger, requiring sustenance of their own element along with the feasts one would expect from such a massive humanoid. Although a simple matter for some giants, more esoteric types find this need a harsh reality. While a massive fistful of ice or snow alongside their meal will satisfy a frost giant, shadow giants hunger for the coagulated shadows of the Netherworld.

7CjSawx6weIPrIFL.description:
Trigger The rune giant uses an arcane ability or casts an arcane spell

Effect The runes on the giant's body flash with magical energy. Each creature within a @Template[emanation|distance:10] must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.
7CjSawx6weIPrIFL.name: Flashing Runes

Cu6pedSvnaK0fqOF.description: When a rune giant casts their innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.R9xqCBblkS5KE4y7]{Sending} spell, they can also cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} on the target.
Cu6pedSvnaK0fqOF.name: Demand

GL9yPOZHTcwW41gZ.description:
The rune giant gains an additional reaction at the beginning of each of their turns that they can use only for a Reactive Strike.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]
GL9yPOZHTcwW41gZ.name: Reactive Strike (Special)

JBksJycZVWAJ0ESS.description:
The rune giant invokes one of the runes on their body, causing the rune to spray forth a @Template[cone|distance:30] of sparks that deals @Damage[6d12[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in the cone (@Check[reflex|dc:37|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The giant can't use Invoke Rune again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Invoke Rune]]{1d4 rounds}.

A glowing copy of the invoked rune appears on a single weapon the giant holds, granting the weapon one effect listed below of the giant's choice. The effect on the weapon lasts for 1 minute. If the giant places a new rune on a weapon, any previously placed rune immediately vanishes, ending its effect.

  • Rune of Destruction The weapon gains the deadly trait with three weapon damage dice of the same die size as for the base weapon, and a creature hit with the weapon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} unless it succeeds at a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] save.
  • Rune of Flames The weapon deals an additional @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage on all attacks.
  • Rune of Smiting When the weapon hits, the giant can Push the target back 10 feet, or 20 feet on a critical hit.
  • Rune of Space During the rune giant's turn, the weapon's reach is increased to 60 feet.
JBksJycZVWAJ0ESS.name: Invoke Rune

QEtmxa7gWeEQIrTf.description:
The target can soar through the air, gaining a fly Speed equal to its Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.MuRBCiZn5IKeaoxi]{Spell Effect: Fly}

Heightened (7th) The duration increases to 1 hour.
QEtmxa7gWeEQIrTf.name: Fly (Constant)

h5JHBi9nGWnsaR3C.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.A2JfEKe6BZcTG1S8]{Fly}

The target can soar through the air, gaining a fly Speed equal to its Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater.
h5JHBi9nGWnsaR3C.name: Spell Effect: Fly

jTCynZS3NcEx1n1y.description:
Your honeyed words are difficult for creatures to resist. You suggest a course of action to the target, which must be phrased in such a way as to seem like a logical course of action to the target and can't be self-destructive or obviously against the target's self-interest. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and knows you tried to control it.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target immediately follows your suggestion. The spell has a duration of 1 minute, or until the target has completed a finite suggestion or the suggestion becomes self-destructive or has other obvious negative effects.

Critical Failure As failure, but the base duration is 1 hour.

Heightened (8th) You can target up to 10 creatures.
jTCynZS3NcEx1n1y.name: Suggestion (At Will)

uwBAscSuJG489hpI.description: When a rune giant casts a mental spell against another giant, the DC is 39, rather than 35
uwBAscSuJG489hpI.name: Command Giants

xeRH37MTBNYg5VvM.description:
To the target, your words are honey and your visage seems bathed in a dreamy haze. It must attempt a Will save, with a +4 circumstance bonus if you or your allies recently threatened it or used hostile actions against it.

You can Dismiss the spell. If you use hostile actions against the target, the spell ends. When the spell ends, the target doesn't necessarily realize it was charmed unless its friendship with you or the actions you convinced it to take clash with its expectations, meaning you could potentially convince the target to continue being your friend via mundane means.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and aware you tried to charm it.

Success The target is unaffected but thinks your spell was something harmless instead of charm, unless it identifies the spell.

Failure The target's attitude becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.v66R7FdOf11l94im]{Friendly} toward you. If it was Friendly, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.v44P3WUcU1j0115l]{Helpful}. It can't use hostile actions against you.

Critical Failure The target's attitude becomes Helpful toward you, and it can't use hostile actions against you.

Heightened (4th) The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations.

Heightened (8th) The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations, and you can target up to 10 creatures.
xeRH37MTBNYg5VvM.name: Charm (At Will)

yUMh1Oa8g3zZ6utm.description: The rune giant makes a single greatsword Strike and compares the attack roll result to the ACs of up to two foes within their reach. This counts as two attacks for the giant's multiple attack penalty.
yUMh1Oa8g3zZ6utm.name: Wide Swing

Commander Yrasthura.name: Commander Yrasthura

Covetous Corridor.description: Statues depicting the runelords of envy steal magic from intruders.
Covetous Corridor.hazardDisable: @Check[arcana|dc:45] (master) to unweave the magic surrounding a statue, @Check[athletics|dc:48] (expert) to wrest a statue's implement from its hands, @Check[thievery|dc:48] (expert) to slip an implement free, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th rank; counteract DC 36) to counteract the magic that empowers the statue. Increase the DCs to disable the Belimarius statue by 2. Each statue must be disabled or counteracted separately, and disabling the Belimarius statue or all nine other statues permanently disables the hazard.
Covetous Corridor.hazardReset: The hazard resets automatically if not disabled.
Covetous Corridor.hazardRoutine: (4 actions) The hazard uses @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} Magic twice. Once the implements of at least three runelord statues are charged, the hazard uses its next available action to Transfer Magic. If the hazard starts its turn with the Belimarius statue charged, the hazard uses its reaction to Empower Barrier. A disabled runelord statue can't use Steal Magic. If the Belimarius statue is disabled, the hazard can't use Transfer Magic or Empower Barrier.
Covetous Corridor.name: Covetous Corridor

4hVO68e0Vy6xGqJM.description: If a reaction would disrupt Dream Aethusa's spellcasting action, she attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.
4hVO68e0Vy6xGqJM.name: Steady Spellcasting

CIu9iou28H8oUpPy.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Dream Aethusa ends one condition affecting her.
CIu9iou28H8oUpPy.name: Remove a Condition

DQGxAOkzjQ2fcEQR.description: When Dream Aethusa dies, a field of iridescent energy envelops her lifeless body (and her gear) for 10 minutes. During this time, any creature that touches Dream Aethusa's body takes @Damage[9d6[force]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:37|basic] save). After 10 minutes have passed, Aethusa's body rises into the air and is consumed by mythic energy, transforming into the Trinity Star hazard.
DQGxAOkzjQ2fcEQR.name: Trinity Star

GMCJIrSuM7XPgJvL.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Dream Aethusa regains an expended spell.
GMCJIrSuM7XPgJvL.name: Recharge

fsOaFQW3AJuD8Sug.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If Dream Aethusa's next action is to cast a cantrip or a spell that is 6th-rank or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).
fsOaFQW3AJuD8Sug.name: Quickened Casting

Earthfall.hazardDisable: @Check[Ocean Lore|dc:42] (expert) or @Check[nature|dc:45] (master) or Survival (master) to chart the flood paths of the coming waves, @Check[crafting|dc:50] (legendary) to reinforce a shelter
Earthfall.hazardRoutine:
(5 minutes) Only the first five minutes of this disaster directly impact the PCs, but during that time, they must contend with the combination of a megatsunami and meteor shower.

Meteor Shower: As meteor shower, but @Damage[7d10[bludgeoning]] damage and @Damage[15d6[fire]] damage to all characters (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save). If at least half the PCs succeeded at Prepare checks, only one randomly determined PC is affected by the meteor shower rather than the whole party.

Tsunami: If at least half the PCs succeed on Prepare checks, they avoid all effects of the megatsunami until the last minute, at which point they're affected as if they were unprepared. Many of Xin-Bakrakhan's citizens are powerful wizards or otherwise have access to flight, be it by spell, wings, or flying minions, but their retreat into the skies above is chaotic. A PC capable of flight (or who is carried aloft by a flying ally) for an entire minute can avoid the tsunami's effects if they succeed at a @Check[acrobatics|dc:35] check to Maneuver in Flight to avoid mid-air collisions with others or falling meteors—on a failure they're forced back into the dangerous waters below and take a –2 circumstance penalty to saves against the tsunami's effects.

The tsunami floods into the lowest elevation area on the 2nd minute, then proceeds up into the higher regions as shown on the map on each of the following minutes. A PC in the area is affected as the standard megatsunami, but @Damage[(6d12+35)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic] save) when they're first struck and then @Damage[(4d12+25)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic]) each minute they're carried along by the wave.
Earthfall.name: Earthfall

Echoes of the End.description: An overwhelming trumpeting fills the area as the apocalypse seed vibrates and shakes off the encrusted bone that's accreted around it to reveal a large tooth fragment from some immense monster.
Echoes of the End.hazardDisable: @Check[arcana|dc:50] (master), @Check[occultism|dc:50] (legendary), or @Check[religion|dc:50] (legendary) to recognize and shore up the area against the localized planar instability causing a connection between the apocalypse seed and Jandelay, or @Check[athletics|dc:53] (legendary) to grasp the apocalypse seed and muffle its vibrations with your embrace. Four successes are needed to muffle the aura enough against the planar instability and end the hazard.
Echoes of the End.hazardReset: The apocalypse seed creates another area of instability after 24 hours.
Echoes of the End.hazardRoutine:
(1 action) Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:44] save. A creature with the slowed condition from this hazard takes a –2 penalty to this save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[(2d10+10)[sonic]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[(4d10+20)[sonic]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the start of the hazard's next turn.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[(8d10+40)[sonic]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round.
Echoes of the End.name: Echoes of the End

Elder Shantak.description:
The imposing shantaks are far more intelligent than their bestial appearance would suggest. They can speak, though their voices sound like glass grinding on stone, and they can't converse in any language besides Aklo.

Shantaks' ability to travel through the gulfs of outer space at supernatural speed allows them to nest on numerous worlds, yet despite this mobility, most shantaks are reluctant to seek out new homes unless faced with no other option. Instead, they roost in discarded ruins or asteroids adrift in space, only emerging and landing upon planets in their chosen stellar system when the urge to feed compels them.

Despite not being native to the Dimension of Dreams, they're commonly found in that realm. Their ability to fly through space affords them swift travel between Leng and more hospitable reaches of the Dreamlands, making them particularly sought after as mounts for those who have business in the far reaches of the dreaming plane.

Convincing a shantak to become a mount is notoriously difficult. They refuse any sort of training, and even if one is convinced to ferry a humanoid on their back, they can be obstinate and fickle. Anyone relying on a shantak mount should have a backup plan ready in case the shantak strands their passenger on an asteroid or strange planet after some disagreement.

Although a shantak is nearly the size of an elephant, many possess irrational fears of certain creatures. In particular, nightgaunts terrify them, but other shantaks have been observed fleeing from harpies and gargoyles. Though these ancestries all share the same trait, shantaks don't fear every type of winged humanoid, which makes the origin of their phobia all the more mysterious. Shantaks on Golarion typically hide themselves away in remote places since several of the creatures they fear appear on the planet in abundance.

6qxKmQ1NJ2m3caTx.description: The elder shantak doesn't breathe and is immune to effects that require breathing (such as inhaled poison).
6qxKmQ1NJ2m3caTx.name: No Breath

HJdHvuhqBc9SkrvJ.description: The shantak's screech deals @Damage[15d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] (@Check[fortitude|dc:33|basic] save). A creature that fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure). The shantak can't use Screech again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Screech]]{1d4 rounds}.
HJdHvuhqBc9SkrvJ.name: Screech

iJaSMrCi07AzcK4L.description:
Trigger A creature is riding the shantak

Effect The shantak extends their no breath ability and cold resistance to a single creature riding them. They can withdraw this protection as a free action.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.zqgntQXIEbulBgZX]{Effect: Share Defenses}
iJaSMrCi07AzcK4L.name: Share Defenses

tX7g78Vle2NcjulW.description: The elder shantak Flies up to their fly speed and makes two claw Strikes at any point during it's movement. Each Strike must target a different creature. The attacks take the normal multiple attack penalty.
tX7g78Vle2NcjulW.name: Flying Strafe

zHIoJ0oELrIHabJu.description: The elder shantak's scales are slimy, granting it a +3 circumstance bonus to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}. A creature mounted on a shantak takes double the normal circumstance penalty to its Reflex saves (–4 instead of –2 in most cases) while mounted.
zHIoJ0oELrIHabJu.name: Slippery

Elder Shantak.name: Elder Shantak

Elemental Tsunami.description:
Elemental tsunamis are huge and destructive, having none of the caring or nurturing aspects of water.

Water elementals can be very destructive, but often not intentionally so; just as water can bring life to mortals in need, its waves can pound shores and rains can flood cities. Water elementals are similarly difficult to predict.

AiKIcXFJx9lEEfnt.description:
The elemental tsunami momentarily expands to fill the area of its vortex. Creatures within the aura take @Damage[(5d12+6)[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:31|basic] save. A creature that fails this save is pushed 20 feet.

The elemental tsunami then shrinks to its normal space and can't Surge again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Surge]]{1d4 rounds}.
AiKIcXFJx9lEEfnt.name: Surge

FTMgXssm5HK4Io0O.description:
50 feet.

Pull 1

Endless Realities.description: A mass of illusions floods the senses of creatures, plunging them into an ever-shifting maze of fluid realties.
Endless Realities.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:38] (legendary) to seize strands of a false reality and tug at them to unravel the surrounding illusions, @Check[arcana|dc:41] to take command of the illusions in a false reality and force them to consume themselves, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th-rank; counteract DC 39) to counteract one of the four realities the illusion creates
Endless Realities.hazardRoutine:
(1 action) The trap shifts from the current reality into a randomly determined one that affects all those lost within the illusion in a different way. The new reality restores 20 Hit Points to itself if it had previously taken damage. Each time a PC succeeds at a check or dispel magic attempt to disable the trap or the current reality is reduced to 0 HP, the current illusory reality vanishes, leaving the PCs in an infinite haze of nothingness save for a three-tailed comet burning in the "sky" above (recognizable as the Trinity Star with a @Check[arcana|dc:25], Nature, Occultism, or Religion check) until the trap takes its next action and randomly determines its new reality from the options that remain. If only one endless reality remains when it's disabled or destroyed, the PCs are returned to the real world and the trap is entirely disabled.

When the endless reality shifts, determine its effects and appearance by randomly selecting from the following (rerolling any results that have already been disabled or destroyed).

Each time a PC critically succeeds at a saving throw to resist a reality's damage, the trap degrades; it's disable DCs and hardness are reduced by 2 with each such critical success. If the trap's hardness is reduced to 0 in this way, the entire trap is disabled at once.

Burning Reality (fire) Additional Immunity fire; Effect The world appears to catch on fire, while legions of burning monsters attack the party. Every PC takes @Damage[10d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|traits:fire] save).

Frozen Reality (cold) Additional Immunity cold; Effect The world appears to crust over with ice, while armies of frozen ghosts assault the PCs. Every PC takes @Damage[10d6[cold]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|traits:cold] save).

Impossible Reality (mental) Additional Immunity physical; Effect The world distorts into a reality of impossible geometry as the PCs feel their own bodies distort to match twisted reflections of unworkable configurations. Every PC takes @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:34|basic|traits:mental] save).

Melting Reality (acid) Additional Immunity acid; Effect The world appears to dissolve away, as slithering oozes swarm out of the surroundings to engulf the PCs. Every PC takes @Damage[10d6[acid]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:34|basic|traits:acid] save).
Endless Realities.name: Endless Realities

Eron of Jandelay.description:
Rarely seen, the erons of Jandelay serve an important function on their apocalyptic home plane. These spindly birdlike creatures tower over the landscape on seven thin legs, covered in ironlike feathers they can hurl with a flick of a wing. Scavengers and collectors, erons dispose of intrusive elements they discover on Jandelay, stashing them in nests for later assortment. Such detritus typically consist of dead adventurers and their gear; an eron won't hesitate to attack a living adventurer, though, and they make little distinction between living or dead "clutter" that doesn't belong.

Remnant Hunters

When an eron of Jandelay finds itself on a doomed world, they often seek out an eclectic list of items, remains, and sometimes even creatures from that planet, almost as if they were picking and choosing their favorite parts of that world before it is no more. Whether the planet is literally on its last days makes no difference to the visiting eron. To these ageless monitors, the actual timing of a world's end is irrelevant to their hunt. Sometimes, valuable scavenged treasures can be discovered amid larger objects or vehicles an eron has been carrying with it via telekinetic haul.

N7cJccJ4PTgfdp4g.description:
90 feet @Check[will|dc:30]

A creature that critically fails a saving throw against an eron's frightful presence is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as they remain frightened.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

SKEOea8tbmnPcpBP.name: Unbalancing Rip

The object must be 2 Bulk or less. If the creature with the target object is in combat or on guard, the eron can still try to Steal the object if it attempts its Thievery check at mythic proficiency.
nrpLGnps0UNl59zd.name: Snatch Prize

vBeyOAMBbs58hdTW.description:
