Erzgeist.description:
Verdorites don't rise from the unquiet spirits of humanoids, or even from the souls of sapient creatures at all. Instead, these vengeful undead manifest when disaster befalls the natural world. When enough life is lost, be it plant or animal life, those anguished souls can accrete into a singularity of sorts—a verdorite.

While many verdorites rose in the aftermath of Earthfall, one type of these brutal spirits was already well-established in the heartland of the nation of Shalast—the erzgeist. First spawned in response to the devastation wreaked on the underground environments of the central Storval Plateau by Runelord Kaladurnae's greed, these creatures persist today in various parts of north-central Varisia—particularly in the region surrounding Spindlehorn.

Erzgeists look like large bats, but they're ghostly and semitransparent. Instead of fur, their bodies show growths of crystals and jagged shards of rock shot through with gold ore—all of it shimmering and phantasmal. Their eyes are glittering rubies, the membrane in their wings is like pale gold smoke, and their teeth and fangs are made of gold—all reflections of one man's environment-destroying greed.

An Erzgeist's Anger

Erzgeists often latch onto specific examples of mortal cruelty against the natural world—but in particular, cruelty against fey. While they aren't and never were from the First World, they're drawn to the pains of tormented fey—not to seek their release, but to lie in wait for others who might be drawn to the same torments. Even those who seek to free the tormented fey find themselves targets of erzgeists' anger.

4ypo1eseeyIjZpmK.description: An erzgeist is bonded to a single cavern or complex of underground tunnels (such as the Prosperity Vault in this adventure) and must remain within them (or within their walls). If the erzgeist moves outside their bonded caverns, they're immediately destroyed.
4ypo1eseeyIjZpmK.name: Cavern Dependent

sPneEae0RNooKN1U.description: Even when a fey creature doesn't want their aid or finds their nature unsettling, an erzgeist is eager to inflict pain on anyone in return for perceived injustices to fey creatures. As long as an erzgeist is within 30 feet of a fey creature that's suffering from a negative condition, the erzgeist gains a +2 status bonus to all attack rolls.
sPneEae0RNooKN1U.name: Fey Avenger

xC2MJwerFtVs8gJk.description: The touch of an erzgeist transforms flesh into gold. When a living creature is damaged by the erzgeist's gilded hand Strike, that creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:41] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute. Further failed saves against aurify increase the clumsy condition. Once a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 5}, they become petrified, except they're transformed into gold instead of stone for 24 hours, after which the creature (or any gold harvested from it) crumbles to worthless dust and dies.
xC2MJwerFtVs8gJk.name: Aurify

Erzgeist.name: Erzgeist

Flawed Memories.description: The murky waters that fill the chamber grant false visions of the past.
Flawed Memories.hazardDisable: @Check[crafting|dc:45] (master) to release alchemical reagents to neutralize the ink in the water, @Check[nature|dc:42] (legendary) to manipulate the primal magic in the region and negate the ink's effects, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th rank; counteract DC 34) to counteract the magical ink in the water; four success are required to disable it (spells that purify or manipulate water, such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qXTB7Ec9yYh5JPPV]{Cleanse Cuisine} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.zfn5RqAdF63neqpP]{Control Water}, can affect this hazard as if the caster were using an equal rank dispel magic)
Flawed Memories.hazardReset: The hazard remains disabled until Baolen refills the area with ink (typically once every 4 hours).

(2 actions) On the trap's first action, it attempts a water jet ranged Strike on all creatures outside of the water in this room or on the stairs leading up to area A5. On its second action, the primal magic infusing the waters attempts to seep into the minds of those within it, forcing each creature in the water to attempt a @Check[will|dc:39] save against the following effects.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected

Success The creature takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 24 hours. While the creature is stupefied, it takes an additional –2 status penalty to checks made to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge}.

Critical Failure As failure, but @Damage[16d6[mental]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}, and the stupefied condition has an unlimited duration.
Flawed Memories.name: Flawed Memories

Gavergash.description:
Long-lived trolls sometimes force their way through the twin distractions of hunger and pain to learn more about the world around them. To manage their regeneration, they learn to cover themselves in crude armor that slowly becomes integrated with the top layer of their flesh. Marked by this armor and aided by their superior wits, these warleaders gather a variety of trolls to serve them in raiding parties.

The warleader presented here is a forest troll, but warleaders can be other types of trolls as well. Many of them are adapted to battle tactics that are best suited to their home environments.

Slavering, cruel, invincible brutes: this is the villager's stock description for the dread monsters known as trolls. The roots of these stories are undoubtedly true. Trolls' flesh endlessly regrows, going so far as to sprout aberrant limbs or additional heads if not pruned, and a bottomless hunger is required to feed such unfettered growth. Even in the process of glutting themselves, however, trolls find opportunities to taunt their prey and inflict petty cruelties.

A troll's ability to survive is so strong that they believe even the smallest scrap of flesh will slowly regenerate into a new form, suffering as all the powers of the land are gathered to revive them. Despite the pain, trolls speak of this unassailable vitality as a blessing from their creator. Few trolls have heard the laughter of demons who claim that creator cursed the trolls and cast them down from lofty heights, binding them so they could never rise again.

Trolls prefer to remain solitary, keeping every scrap of food for themselves. In rare instances, an old and powerful troll comes to lead groups of trolls. Such warleaders possess enough cunning to lead their hordes in devastating raids and massacres, and their presence permanently alters the surrounding ecosystem. This link to their environment is an often misunderstood aspect of trollkind, and grows more acute with a troll's age and power. That's not to say trolls are valorous protectors of nature. They're vicious and territorial, and will blight their own territory forever if it means more to eat for a day.

3wMfK5zZSqFhhTgs.description:
The troll warleader unleashes a bestial roar. Each non-troll creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:100] must attempt a @Check[will|dc:29] save. The creature is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Awaken Totem for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Goldgorger.description: Oregorgers are hulking, four-limbed brutes with bodies of raw primal metals accreted in layers. Driven entirely by an insatiable drive to consume metal, an oregorger stops at nothing to greedily devour as much metal as it can and expel it as caustic rust.

509qOyqLd5OdAHZE.description: Any time the goldgorger scores a critical hit with an adamantine bite attack, it deals the same amount of damage to any metal armor worn by the target, automatically bypassing any Hardness lower than 20. If a creature uses the Shield Block reaction with a metal shield against a goldgorger's adamantine bite, the shield is automatically broken, but no other item takes damage from that attack. Unattended metal items automatically take full damage from a goldgorger's adamantine bite, ignoring their Hardness if it's lower than 20.
509qOyqLd5OdAHZE.name: Devour Metal

V2A2zDEWM0yMtLB1.description: 5 feet. The goldgorger continually leaks tiny fragments of partially digested gold into the air around it. Any creature that ends its turn in the aura takes @Damage[8d6[acid]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:37|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:sickened] save. A creature that critically fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.
V2A2zDEWM0yMtLB1.name: Caustic Slivers

cGhPeUIuvKKzGoE1.description: The goldgorger belches forth a cloud of caustic debris from its maw, filling a cube adjacent to it that's 10 feet on each side. Any creature in this area takes @Damage[6d10[acid],6d10[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic|options:area-effect] save). The ground under the cloud is difficult terrain for 1 hour, after which the shrapnel crumbles to dust. The goldgorger can't use Searing Spew again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Searing Spew]]{1d4 rounds}, but the ability recharges if the goldgorger damages an item with devour metal.

rDukP9s5TtLABcyy.description: The goldgorger ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from rust clouds.
rDukP9s5TtLABcyy.name: Rust Vision

Goldgorger.name: Goldgorger

Greedspawn.description:
Sinspawn were created by one of seven ancient wizards known collectively as runelords—each of whom embraced and embodied one of seven sins. The first sinspawn was created by the Runelord of Wrath, utilizing techniques that have since gone on to influence fleshwarping practices. It wasn't long before the technique used to create sinspawn fell into the hands of the other runelords, and while each tried their own hand at crafting variants of their own design, today, sinspawn of wrath remain the most numerous and notorious of their kind.

Bearing only a vague resemblance to the humanoids from whose flesh they were formed, sinspawn generally appear horrifically emaciated and have unnaturally long arms and digitigrade legs, each with a trio of stubby, taloned digits. Veins bulge across sinspawn's bodies in sanguine patterns that suspiciously resemble twisted runes, and their flesh is pale and hairless. Their heads are elongated, with slits for a nose, red eyes, and disturbing lower jaws that split in half at the chin, revealing pedipalps that end in tiny, three-fingered hands and framing a long, lolling tongue.

Sinspawn stand 6-1/2 feet tall and typically weigh as much as an emaciated human of their size. They behave in a manner consistent with their associated sin and have physical characteristics that hint at these qualities. For example, greedspawn's veins appear to run with gold, while envyspawn appear even more gaunt than the rest of their kin.

HMAwKSWulWoNHitX.description:
Trigger The greedspawn soldier knocks an item out of a target's grasp with a critical success on a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} attempt

HMAwKSWulWoNHitX.name: Snatch Up

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is sickened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for 1 minute.

Haunted Forge.description: The rundown furnaces blaze to life, filling with metal and fire, while the wall of hardened lava to the east appears to revert to red hot molten rock.
Haunted Forge.hazardDisable: @Check[religion|dc:38] (master) to exorcise the spirits or @Check[intimidation|dc:41] to quell them with furious anger; three total successes are required to disable the haunt
Haunted Forge.hazardRoutine:
(4 actions) The burning spirits shriek and howl, swooping in and out of the forges to the south, which roar into scorching life. The spirits scoop up gobs of phantasmal molten dawnsilver and hurl them at different targets in the room. Up to four randomly determined creatures are targeted in this way with molten dawnsilver Strikes (the spirits can target any creature in area B5). A single creature may be targeted only once per round, so if there are fewer than four different targets, the haunt's extra actions are lost. The haunt also loses two actions from its routine if one of the two forges are destroyed.

On a critical hit from a molten dawnsilver Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round as the molten dawnsilver swiftly cools and encases the target. Molten dawnsilver produced by the haunt vanishes entirely 1 round after it's been thrown.
Haunted Forge.name: Haunted Forge

Insatiable Bore Worm Swarm.description:
A single finger-length bore worm is unpleasant but mostly innocuous. Ten thousand bore worms, on the other hand, pose a formidable threat to even seasoned adventurers. The countless worms form a roiling, rancid mass of acid and pain, capable of delivering a hideous death to any person or beast unable to escape them. Unfortunately for any creature other than a bore worm, most encounters involve swarms.

These Darklands vermin produce corrosive, noxious slime and deliver agonizing bites, whether as a revolting, wriggling swarm of finger-length worms or a single massive, lurching beast. Among Darklands communities, most inhabitants regard bore worms much in the same way surface cultures speak of maggots or cockroaches-with general disdain and revulsion. Children consider catching a single bore worm and using it to torment others a rite of passage, albeit a dangerous one.

The humble bore worm is a small and simple creature, both biologically and magically. These qualities allow it to adapt rapidly to different environments, some of them quite extreme, and also makes it susceptible to magical radiation and experimentation. Many a Darklands apprentice takes their first steps in the school of transmutation by practicing on these worms, while variations-both natural and cultivated-are scattered about beneath Golarion's surface.

OLXpGW8u6XmpJXAp.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[8d6[acid]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic] save). Creatures that fail this save become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} from the swarm's painful bites. On a critical failure, the painful bites cause the creature to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}. In either case, the slowed condition persists for 1 round.
OLXpGW8u6XmpJXAp.name: Painful Devouring

Insatiable Bore Worm Swarm.name: Insatiable Bore Worm Swarm

Jandelay Tolokand.description:
Streams run dry. The earth cracks. Green leaves brown and shatter. And the creature walks on.

The faceless, unknowable tolokands wander the land, bringing desolation with every footfall-belching poisonous smoke, blighting plant life, cracking the earth asunder, and even staining the ground with their foul blood. They turn habitable places into wastelands, which has earned tolokands the name "waste walkers."

These walking forces of destruction don't make their motives known. They remain unmoved by any pleas or threats levied at them, and they fight off attacks only so that they can return to their grim business. However, they have one consistent tendency: they travel to environments on the brink. A tolokand appears in a land wracked by famine or a natural disaster to give it the last push into oblivion.

Tolokands are mercifully few in number. Since they appear so rarely, it's unclear whether there are just a few individuals or several dozen. Clearly, more than one exists, though, because their patterned soles are as distinctive as fingerprints. Often, these smoking footprints are all that remain in a blighted land.

3ltFeU7t0v6ZbQqL.description:
Requirements The tolokand hasn't cast any of its spontaneous spells this turn

Effect The tolokand casts one of its spontaneous spells, using up the spell slot normally. The tolokand can't cast any further spontaneous spells this turn and can't use this ability again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Sudden Destruction]]{1d4 rounds}.
3ltFeU7t0v6ZbQqL.name: Sudden Destruction

FQ4QWZ3U0T1vmHFB.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The Jandelay tolokand ends one condition affecting themself.
FQ4QWZ3U0T1vmHFB.name: Remove a Condition

HvbA2JrPJX04mXf4.description: Smoke doesn't impair a tolokand's vision; it ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.
HvbA2JrPJX04mXf4.name: Smoke Vision

I7lMAhjCqMyxPu6y.description: The tolokand recovers from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} conditions at the end of its turn. It's also immune to penalties to its Speeds and ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.
I7lMAhjCqMyxPu6y.name: Inexorable

Na4ZinpZPOodP1WY.description: Whenever the tolokand ends a move action during which it moved 30 feet or farther, it automatically casts one of its innate spells as a free action.
Na4ZinpZPOodP1WY.name: Blighted Footfalls

fJlI13pn1Y8ntWFP.description:
50 feet. @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:37|basic] save).

The poisonous smoke that bellows from a tolokand makes all creatures inside it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the smoke are concealed to creatures within it.
fJlI13pn1Y8ntWFP.name: Heartless Furnace

mpDohzU1L0FfV4Tr.description: When a creature scores a critical hit against the tolokand with a piercing or slashing Strike, the tolokand's poisonous, oily blood sprays forth. Any creature within @Template[emanation|distance:5]{5 feet} of the tolokand takes @Damage[3d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic|options:area-effect] save). Any non-creature plants the blood spills on die.
mpDohzU1L0FfV4Tr.name: Toxic Blood

szNUIcIcOToW3b6C.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The Jandelay tolokand regains an expended spell.
szNUIcIcOToW3b6C.name: Recharge

zg034Oefe1w3sHwh.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal Magic

Jandelay Tolokand.name: Jandelay Tolokand
Jandelay Tolokand.npcAllSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal magic

Javownir.description: Beings of inscrutable intent and incredible power, dramofirs hail from the Dreamlands and shamble across the multiverse in search of dreams to incorporate into their voluminous robes. Few people on the Material Plane dare trifle with dramofirs and instead treat them with respect, hoping that they'll simply take their chosen victims' dreams and then go away. Often, this is exactly what happens. Every now and then, however, in the process of siphoning an individual's dreams, the dramofir slays their victim without warning or apparent cause.

BskkanKxSINfDBr9.description:
The dramofir swishes their robes in a mesmerizing display that brings the dreams in the robes to life before the viewer's very eyes. Each creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} must attempt a @Check[will|dc:34] save or be filled with ennui.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Success For 1 round, the creature takes a -1 status penalty to attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks, and all other emotion effects on it are suppressed.

Failure As success, but the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and the duration is [[/gmr 1d4 #Duration Bittersweet Dreams]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure As success, but the creature is also slowed 1, the status penalty is -2, and the duration is 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4FginnDcOt4wfedf]{Effect: Bittersweet Dreams}
BskkanKxSINfDBr9.name: Bittersweet Dreams

ENpP2o2H3ia9c6NJ.description: A dramofir has resistance 10 to precision damage and the extra damage from critical hits. If the resistance is greater than the extra damage, it reduces the extra damage to 0 but doesn't reduce the attack's normal damage.
ENpP2o2H3ia9c6NJ.name: Surreal Anatomy

LtMnRFGdEZ9u0QFh.description:
Requirements The dramofir is adjacent to an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} or sleeping creature

Effect The dramofir licks the creature's forehead, places their hand in the same spot, and siphons the creature's dreams to incorporate into their robes.

If the target is affected by any mental effect altering their dreams, such as an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core-2.Actor.r3PNRpEir4BVjnCC]{Animate Dream's} curse of endless nightmares or a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare} spell, the dramofir attempts to counteract that effect (counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+26 #Counteract]]{+26}). Otherwise, the dramofir plucks a benign dream from the creature, and the target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the next time it gets a full night's rest.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}, and Javownir casts a 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GP3wewkQXEPrLxYj]{Subconscious Suggestion} on the target (typically suggesting the target seeks out frightening situations so that their dreams become more nightmarish over time).
LtMnRFGdEZ9u0QFh.name: Replace Dream

Javownir.name: Javownir

Kandirvek.description:
Fate is a fickle matter on Golarion. Even with prophecy broken on the world, there are ways to look to the immediate future or acquire a vague sense of long-term events. Omen dragons are bound to see the future—nebulous though it might be—at all times. Visions of the future hound them like a quiet song that never stops playing in their minds. While an omen dragon can focus on or ignore the music of fate at any time, the song plays all the same. At a glance, omen dragons resemble other occult dragons in appearance, save for the mirror-like interior membrane of their wings. An omen dragon's wings offer glimpses into the future. These glimpses are cloudy and vague, but generally correct, if only technically. Omen dragons have a natural compulsion to share the futures they see. These dragons have no compunctions about what the visions show and share their knowledge equally with innocent villagers as they do with wicked tyrants.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

2phPU9xYaMSKFNol.description:
The dragon or any ally can glimpse into the future through the dragon's wings in a process that requires 10 minutes of concentration. This casts a 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Augury} spell, except that the wings can predict results up to 1 month into the future and the dragon always speaks a few cryptic words related to the result of the prediction.

The dragon can use their wings in this way only once per day, and a given creature can seek a future in the wings only once per week.
2phPU9xYaMSKFNol.name: Prophetic Wings

7jMTgXw900gW0HWP.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

I2kJG5snUvdVtlrm.description:
The dragon breathes a translucent mist of potentialities that overwhelms creatures with visions of possible features, dealing @Damage[13d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:40] (@Check[will|dc:34|options:area-effect] save). A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) as it struggles with the visions.

The dragon can't use Destiny Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Destiny Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
I2kJG5snUvdVtlrm.name: Destiny Breath

IqwLfEmNC9TAiyzF.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The dragon splits themself into two versions with different fates. Each copy Strides or Flies from the dragon's current space, then takes a single action. If the actions are both attacks, they use the same multiple attack penalty and count as one attack toward the dragon's multiple attack penalty.

After both actions, the dragon chooses one of the two locations as their actual destination and the other version of themself disappears.
IqwLfEmNC9TAiyzF.name: Walk the Timelines

NcECPJpz8Y3Qd9BE.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted by an attack;

Effect This fate is not set in stone. The attacker rolls the triggering attack twice and uses the worse result.
NcECPJpz8Y3Qd9BE.name: Challenge Fate

WjY0WmlZBVHL6RtF.description: The dragon recharges their Destiny Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.
WjY0WmlZBVHL6RtF.name: Draconic Momentum

aJ5Jw0ozWjNooF13.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.
aJ5Jw0ozWjNooF13.name: Draconic Frenzy

m1wESAZSSsfNS2AF.description: The dragon can choose to negate any fortune or misfortune effects that would affect them; other creatures remain affected normally.
m1wESAZSSsfNS2AF.name: Untethered to Fate

Kandirvek.name: Kandirvek
Kandirvek.npcAllSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. occult

Killing Fugue.description: A vision of a terrifying presence (the King in Yellow, the Crawling Chaos, or some other horror beyond imagining) overwhelms an unfortunate explorer, putting them into waking stupor that quickly turns into a homicidal fugue.
Killing Fugue.hazardDisable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:48] (master) to talk the affected individual out of the killing fugue, @Check[occultism|dc:45] (legendary) to recognize the spiritual attack taking place and help the victim to resist its effects; four successes are required to disable the nightmare
Killing Fugue.hazardReset: As long as a creature remains under the effects of the nightmare, it cannot reset. Once a creature has either recovered from the effects or died, the nightmare resets in [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.
Killing Fugue.hazardRoutine:
(3 actions; curse) The killing fugue attempts to force a creature under the stupefying effects of deathly vision into taking violent actions against their allies. The affected creature can still take its normal turn of actions on its own turn, but on the killing fugue's turn they perform actions as decided upon by the GM. The killing fugue then spends the appropriate amount of actions to perform those actions and activities. The affected creature can attempt a @Check[will|dc:40|traits:curse] save each time the killing fugue attempts to force them to take actions in this way with the following results.

Critical Success The character throws off the killing fugue's influence, ending the nightmare.

Success The character prevents the killing fugue from taking the attempted action or activity.

Failure The character is forced to take the action or activity chosen by the killing fugue.

Critical Failure As failure, but the character can no longer attempt Will saves to resist the killing fugue.
Killing Fugue.name: Killing Fugue

Knight of Malice.description:
Knights of malice are powerful, winged sinspawn, cultivated for the abundance of jealousy and hatred in their hearts. The knights scheme and strive to undermine each other, nourishing their animosity like any other soldier might train to foster camaraderie and teamwork with their allies. Each knight dreams of the day they prove their power and worthiness to the runelord of envy and reap their just rewards.

A Source of Malice

While other runelords abandoned the original sinspawn creation ritual in favor of using minor runewells, Belimarius instead innovated and perfected the original ritual used to create sinspawn, using it to empower a sinspawn through repeated and nested castings. Her knights of malice are washed in the souls of dozens of envious creatures each, reaching greater heights of envy than any other sinspawn.

1o7LfKSVJ3T02v6w.description: A knight of malice can smell envious creatures as the scent ability, but as a precise sense. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately envious.
1o7LfKSVJ3T02v6w.name: Sin Scent

CT26lxezsWYihotn.description:
A creature hit by the jaws Strike of a knight of malice must attempt a @Check[will|dc:37] save as it's assaulted by envious thoughts.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute. For as long as it remains stupefied, the flat check to end the confused condition when the creature is damaged is DC 14.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}.
CT26lxezsWYihotn.name: Sinful Bite

EjNDrlNv7xVzCRd5.description:
Requirements Another knight of malice is within the area of the knight's spiteful eye aura

Effect The knight of malice ruminates on their unjust treatment and plots a new method of overthrowing and outshining another knight. The knight of malice gains a second reaction until the start of their next turn, though they still can't use more than one reaction on the same triggering action.
EjNDrlNv7xVzCRd5.name: Seethe

MblbLRxDYhRr6eKt.description: 30 feet. Knights of malice hate to see others succeed and sabotage the efforts of other knights whenever they can. The knight of malice takes a –2 circumstance penalty to Reflex saving throws and their Strikes deal an extra 1d6 mental damage if there's at least one other knight of malice in the aura.
MblbLRxDYhRr6eKt.name: Spiteful Eye

OzkswzRpdRUEUvdI.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

WErPCA0kGRxePKiB.description:
Trigger Another knight of malice successfully Strikes a creature within 15 feet

Requirements The knight of malice Seethed during their last turn

Effect The knight of malice Strides up to 15 feet and makes a melee Strike against the same creature. The knight of malice who rolled a higher result on their attack becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round and can use the extra action only to Seethe or Stride.
WErPCA0kGRxePKiB.name: Jealous Enmity

Knight of Malice.name: Knight of Malice
Knight of Malice.npcAllSaves: +1 status to saves vs. magic, +4 status to saves vs. mental

Kraken Caller.description:
Scouts, usually young sedacthies, ply the ocean in search of animal servants or tread ashore to hunt. Scouts hunting on the surface press crocodiles and snakes into service, while those underwater prefer electric eels and hippocampi.

Sedacthies are amphibious, fish-like humanoids who lurk in Golarion's oceans and are known for leading their animal servants ashore to devour air breathers. When an entire fishing village disappears overnight, sedacthies are the first suspects. Sedacthies pride themselves as natural leaders, with ambition limited only by their strict adherence to hierarchy. A sedacthy's station is determined by the strength of the animal servants they press into service, and the mettle they prove during hunts and in battles against outsiders.

B0SPjSFAOw4yPnrw.description: A sedacthy speaking Thalassic can be understood by any animal that has a swim Speed or the amphibious or aquatic trait. By spending a week regularly interacting with such an animal, the sedacthy can make it permanently helpful.
B0SPjSFAOw4yPnrw.name: Sea Speech

xkke602pekBofSGw.description: The sedacthy makes a jaws Strike. If it hits, an ally of their choice can spend a reaction to make a jaws Strike against the same target. Allies with beaks or similar attacks can use those instead of jaws.
xkke602pekBofSGw.name: Shared Feast

Kraken Caller.name: Kraken Caller

7ol1VPXcYU3mir7h.description:
Requirements Liralarue isn't stupefied

Trigger Liralarue fails a saving throw or attack roll

Effect Liralarue rerolls the saving throw or attack roll that triggered this reaction. She then experiences confusing visions of multiple futures all at once and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the end of her next turn.
7ol1VPXcYU3mir7h.name: Glimpse Uncertain Future

IEg1flsvzYqKBOpy.description: You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion, morph or polymorph effect in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the polymorph spell).
IEg1flsvzYqKBOpy.name: Truesight (Constant)

JpRyc8XY1NwGWSE0.description: You peek into the future. Choose a particular goal or activity you plan to engage in within 1 week, or an event you expect might happen within 1 week. You learn a cryptic clue or piece of advice that could help with the chosen event, often in the form of a rhyme or omen.
JpRyc8XY1NwGWSE0.name: Read Omens (AT Will)

WqAV7alJ4tA3xLVL.description: Liralarue is made from solid dream-stuff. She no longer needs to sleep, breathe, eat, or drink. In return, she can't further develop her powers or exist outside the Dimension of Dreams—if she's forced out of the Dreamlands, she vanishes, then reappears 1 year later in the Dreamlands. She can be killed normally, but barring such an event, she could live forever as she no longer ages.
WqAV7alJ4tA3xLVL.name: Living Dream

aptdqaQTqpZz0kup.description: When Liralarue casts the following spells on a PC or an item they carry while they're visiting her in dream, the lasting effects and results of that spell persist into the waking world: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.C2w3YfBKjIRS07DP]{Hidden Mind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dMKP4fkWx8V2cqAy]{Remake}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rsZ5c0AUyywe5yoK]{Retrocognition}.
aptdqaQTqpZz0kup.name: Beyond Dreams

0H6eoCpp4LnepVBd.description:
Trigger A creature within Lograsi's reach attempts to Strike Lograsi with a melee weapon

Effect Lograsi attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. The triggering creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to this attack. If the attack is a critical hit, Lograsi disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward his multiple attack penalty, and his multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.
0H6eoCpp4LnepVBd.name: Unexpected Parry

6CPfl8PXerZ8MWqg.description: When Lograsi rolls a success on a Reflex save, he gets a critical success instead. He isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to hidden, undetected, or flanking creatures of level 18 or lower.
6CPfl8PXerZ8MWqg.name: Evasive Response

Ku6Kz1t9gnedEVMs.description:
Trigger Lograsi's Strike hits an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creature and deals damage

Effect The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and takes a –10 foot status penalty to their Speeds from overwhelming chills that numb their flesh. This lasts until the end of Lograsi's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.cBxjqExA5RZ4UNAz]{Effect: Numbing Strike}
Ku6Kz1t9gnedEVMs.name: Numbing Strike

cfzcyOiq422WsPxt.description:
Trigger Lograsi rolls initiative or Leaps

Effect As one of the favored pawns of the velstrac demagogue Aroggus, Lograsi has been granted a pair of shadowy wings. When he activates his Shadowy Wings, they spring from his back and grant him a 40-foot fly Speed. He can sustain his Shadowy Wings for one round at the start of his turn as a free action. As long as his Shadowy Wings are active, Lograsi gains a +2 status bonus on all Acrobatics and Stealth checks.
cfzcyOiq422WsPxt.name: Shadowy Wings

m2ijEdn92jKIbhVh.description: Lograsi does an additional 3d6 precision damage to creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}.
m2ijEdn92jKIbhVh.name: Sneak Attack

0gUbmlS75rNhwn8y.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Lythazossa ends one condition affecting her.
0gUbmlS75rNhwn8y.name: Remove a Condition

3InUu5HhWI6X6Xz3.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Trigger Lythazossa fails a check

Effect Lythazossa rerolls the check.
3InUu5HhWI6X6Xz3.name: Reroll

3e9ZF6cPy6bB1s5v.description: When Lythazossa hits a creature with her jaws Strike, the target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:42] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} until Lythazossa's spirit is put to rest. If the target critically fails this saving throw, Lythazossa regains 40 HP, and the target is instead @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}.
3e9ZF6cPy6bB1s5v.name: Vestige of an Ancient Curse

Aewt2uhDyKAPLwH0.description: When Lythazossa is destroyed, she re-forms after [[/gmr 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} in the Prosperity Vault, fully healed. She can be permanently destroyed if the apocalypse seed is removed from Varisia.
Aewt2uhDyKAPLwH0.name: Rejuvenation

CHwGZAQGD9CfygBx.description: Lythazossa cries out in pain and anguish, hurling small objects and debris is a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[10d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save).
CHwGZAQGD9CfygBx.name: Telekinetic Assault

PsgDeAc9auoGJb6s.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Lythazossa can use Soul-Melting Breath again.
PsgDeAc9auoGJb6s.name: Recharge

cdWZwK3qe0jnfg3m.description:
Cost all of Lythazossa's Mythic Points

Trigger Lythazossa would be destroyed and has at least 1 Mythic Point

Effect Lythazossa remains active, and recovers @Damage[140[healing]] Hit Points.
cdWZwK3qe0jnfg3m.name: Undying Myth

gXmfmVk7LU5NIH03.description: The creature treats its saving throws with the associated save as one degree of success better than it rolled. This is not cumulative with other effects that change their degree of success, like the incapacitation trait (except for rolling a natural 1 or 20). Each time the monster gains mythic resilience, choose one save. The ability should apply to the creature's highest saves first.
gXmfmVk7LU5NIH03.name: Mythic Resilience (Reflex)

lyiNGISJUNjFm1KU.description:
You repel effects that would hinder a creature or slow its movement. While under this spell's effect, the target ignores effects that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed. When they attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} an effect that has them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, they automatically succeed unless the effect is magical and of a higher rank than the unfettered movement spell.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.CdAyAiMGESvgNQtz]{Spell Effect: Unfettered Movement}
lyiNGISJUNjFm1KU.name: Unfettered Movement (Constant)

q1fqaxiO1N044hVt.description:
Lythazossa laments her cursed fate. Each living creature within 30 feet attempts a @Check[will|dc:42] save with the following results.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Calamitous Roar for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}
q1fqaxiO1N044hVt.name: Calamitous Roar

srxgnwyePoh6eNiG.description: Lythazossa expels a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] of ghostly acid that melts a creature's very soul, dealing @Damage[20d6[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures in the area (@Check[will|dc:42|basic] save). The ghostly acid also saps the life from affected creatures. At the beginning of Lythazossa's next turn, each creature that failed the Reflex save must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:42] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure). Lythazossa can't use Soul-Melting Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Soul-Melting Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
srxgnwyePoh6eNiG.name: Soul-Melting Breath

xKagdlQ5eMZsL82C.description: You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion, morph or polymorph effect in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the polymorph spell).
xKagdlQ5eMZsL82C.name: Truesight (Constant)

Lythazossa.name: Lythazossa
Lythazossa.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Maddenmist.description:
High-ranking sedacthies are expected to both plan campaigns and wade into battle. These speakers achieve their rank by accumulating several large servants or a single massive creature like a megalodon.

Sedacthies are amphibious, fish-like humanoids who lurk in Golarion's oceans and are known for leading their animal servants ashore to devour air breathers. When an entire fishing village disappears overnight, sedacthies are the first suspects. Sedacthies pride themselves as natural leaders, with ambition limited only by their strict adherence to hierarchy. A sedacthy's station is determined by the strength of the animal servants they press into service, and the mettle they prove during hunts and in battles against outsiders.

PFfgCTnWRutUzMOD.description: A sedacthy speaking Thalassic can be understood by any animal that has a swim Speed or the amphibious or aquatic trait. By spending a week regularly interacting with such an animal, the sedacthy can make it permanently helpful.
PFfgCTnWRutUzMOD.name: Sea Speech

nJmJQJMSxWIToPze.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Maddenmist is carrying his staff

Effect Maddenmist expends the magical power stored in his greater staff of arcane might. During the current turn, Maddenmist can cast one spell he prepared today and already cast without spending a spell slot. He must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements.
nJmJQJMSxWIToPze.name: Drain Bonded Item

Maddenmist.name: Maddenmist

Malfunctioning Perfumery (Eastern).description: The magically and mechanically automated tools Sorshen used to aid in the crafting of perfume on the long, eastern workbench have interacted in unexpected ways, transforming the workshop into a dangerous peril.
Malfunctioning Perfumery (Eastern).hazardDisable: @Check[crafting|dc:52] (legendary) to quickly introduce neutralizing agents into the alchemical machinery, @Check[thievery|dc:55] (master) to disable the mechanized portions of the devices, or @Check[arcana|dc:55] (master) to counteract magical elements; four total successes are required to disable the hazard (destroying one of the four workbenches counts as one success)
Malfunctioning Perfumery (Eastern).hazardRoutine:
(5 actions) On its initiative, the malfunctioning perfumery takes the following five actions, in order. For each success at disabling it, the hazard loses one action. The targets for actions 2–5 are randomly chosen from creatures in the room, with no one creature being targeted more than once before all other creatures in the room have been targeted. For example, a party of 4 PCs will each be targeted by one of these actions. If just a single PC is in the room, they will be targeted by all four.

  • 1: Crushing Notes 1 (olfactory, poison) The malfunctioning machinery exudes a blast of concentrated and overwhelming perfume notes into area B11. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:15|traits:olfactory,poison] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} on a critical failure).
  • 2: Nozzle Spray 1 (poison) Nozzles built into the machinery extend out to spray toxic, overwhelmingly cloying perfume in multiple directions. One randomly determined target in area B11 takes @Damage[14d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:45|basic|traits:poison] save).
  • 3: Sillage 1 (emotion, mental) A larger, more intimidating nozzle than the one utilized in the previous action extends forward and violently sprays a staggering array of different scents at a random target in the room. The overwhelming mixture of lingering scent (the perfume's sillage) causes the creature to take @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:45|basic|traits:emotion,mental] save); on a failed save, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round by the overwhelming scents.
  • 4: Oil Spill 1 (fire) Sparks from grinding machinery ignite a patch of spilled oil somewhere in the room—a random creature in area B11 takes @Damage[10d6[fire],4d6[persistent,fire]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:45|basic|traits:fire] save).
  • 5: Boiling Beaker 1 (emotion, mental) A pressurized beaker containing boiling fluids springs a leak, and a dislodged tube sprays disorienting, psychotropic fumes at a random creature in the room, who must then succeed at a @Check[will|dc:44|traits:emotion,mental] save to avoid becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure).
Malfunctioning Perfumery (Eastern).name: Malfunctioning Perfumery (Eastern)

Malfunctioning Perfumery (Freestanding).description: The magically and mechanically automated tools Sorshen used to aid in the crafting of perfume on the long, eastern workbench have interacted in unexpected ways, transforming the workshop into a dangerous peril.
Malfunctioning Perfumery (Freestanding).hazardDisable: @Check[crafting|dc:52] (legendary) to quickly introduce neutralizing agents into the alchemical machinery, @Check[thievery|dc:55] (master) to disable the mechanized portions of the devices, or @Check[arcana|dc:55] (master) to counteract magical elements; four total successes are required to disable the hazard (destroying one of the four workbenches counts as one success)
Malfunctioning Perfumery (Freestanding).hazardRoutine:
(5 actions) On its initiative, the malfunctioning perfumery takes the following five actions, in order. For each success at disabling it, the hazard loses one action. The targets for actions 2–5 are randomly chosen from creatures in the room, with no one creature being targeted more than once before all other creatures in the room have been targeted. For example, a party of 4 PCs will each be targeted by one of these actions. If just a single PC is in the room, they will be targeted by all four.

  • 1: Crushing Notes 1 (olfactory, poison) The malfunctioning machinery exudes a blast of concentrated and overwhelming perfume notes into area B11. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:15|traits:olfactory,poison] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} on a critical failure).
  • 2: Nozzle Spray 1 (poison) Nozzles built into the machinery extend out to spray toxic, overwhelmingly cloying perfume in multiple directions. One randomly determined target in area B11 takes @Damage[14d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:45|basic|traits:poison] save).
  • 3: Sillage 1 (emotion, mental) A larger, more intimidating nozzle than the one utilized in the previous action extends forward and violently sprays a staggering array of different scents at a random target in the room. The overwhelming mixture of lingering scent (the perfume's sillage) causes the creature to take @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:45|basic|traits:emotion,mental] save); on a failed save, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round by the overwhelming scents.
  • 4: Oil Spill 1 (fire) Sparks from grinding machinery ignite a patch of spilled oil somewhere in the room—a random creature in area B11 takes @Damage[10d6[fire],4d6[persistent,fire]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:45|basic|traits:fire] save).
  • 5: Boiling Beaker 1 (emotion, mental) A pressurized beaker containing boiling fluids springs a leak, and a dislodged tube sprays disorienting, psychotropic fumes at a random creature in the room, who must then succeed at a @Check[will|dc:44|traits:emotion,mental] save to avoid becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure).
Malfunctioning Perfumery (Freestanding).name: Malfunctioning Perfumery (Freestanding)

Maze-Weaver.description: The monstrous, bloated spiders from the windswept realm of Leng build eerie, dangerous lairs with the aid of magically compelled slaves. Leng spiders have anywhere from five to 13 legs, but never an even number.

0hkOF2WHkLhHAEjQ.description:
The Leng spider moves straight down up to 120 feet, suspended by a web line. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on a Web doesn't count when calculating falling damage.

The web can be severed by a Strike that deals slashing damage (AC 30, Hardness 15, 25 HP), causing the Leng spider to fall.
0hkOF2WHkLhHAEjQ.name: Descend on a Web

iZxDrmolCkhIxWO6.description: A Leng spider can use a web bola to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} a target with the Athletics skill. The skill check takes a -2 circumstance penalty. A web bola deals no damage when used to Trip.
iZxDrmolCkhIxWO6.name: Ranged Trip

iw7xcu7OkpYHYyQ2.description: The maze-weaver senses when a creature touches its webs, even if it is on another plane of existence. While touching its webs, the maze-weaver has precise tremorsense to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its webs.
iw7xcu7OkpYHYyQ2.name: Interdimensional Web Sense

k4tbzCH8jMb0d1Qk.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:33]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round); the confused effect has the emotion and mental traits.
k4tbzCH8jMb0d1Qk.name: Leng Spider Venom

ndqNuLy3iEegO8zG.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The maze-weaver teleports to a space containing its webs, even if it is on another plane of existence.
ndqNuLy3iEegO8zG.name: Web Step

sWbaqjXgO4EigI5j.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The Leng spider spins a web within 20 feet of itself to create a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TFnr9Gq7VXPJu0GQ]{Grasping Snare}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.a2XaerM1KkPyLIPM]{Stunning Snare}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XU8u9F3uoesGDjgM]{Warning Snare}. The Leng spider's web provides all the raw materials it needs. All save and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DCs associated with web traps use the Leng spider's Crafting DC for traps (DC 36). A web trap decays after 24 hours.
sWbaqjXgO4EigI5j.name: Lay Web Trap

snsO2nPGYHe6pZx0.description: The Leng spider creates a weapon by applying a cord of webbing to heavy objects, such as rocks or chunks of metal, either attaching two heavy objects together to create a web bola or fastening one to its leg to create a web war flail.
snsO2nPGYHe6pZx0.name: Create Web Weaponry

Maze-Weaver.name: Maze-Weaver
Maze-Weaver.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Megatsunami.description: A tsunami can be a devastating disaster but pales in comparison to the daunting wall of water created by a megatsunami. When a megatsunami begins, ocean water often recedes far away from the shore, much more dramatically than it would during low tide. This warning sign might occur only seconds or minutes before the full force of the megatsunami crashes onto the land in the form of a wave whose height can exceed a hundred feet.
Megatsunami.hazardDisable: @Check[Ocean Lore|dc:36] (expert) or @Check[nature|dc:38] or @Check[survival|dc:38] (master) to chart the flood path, @Check[crafting|dc:38] (master) to reinforce a shelter, or @Check[athletics|dc:40] (expert) to quickly ferry people or supplies to higher ground,
Megatsunami.hazardRoutine:
(5+ minutes, @Check[flat|dc:18]) The megatsunami's wave overtakes and crushes everything in its path. It rips buildings off their foundations and tears up trees by their roots. Prepared creatures have managed to reach an area of high ground or another form of safety, but unprepared creatures in the area are caught up in the flood and battered by a combination of water and debris.

Unprepared creatures take @Damage[(5d12+30)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:43|basic] save) when the megatsunami hits and are thereafter surrounded by water. If they can't breathe water, they must hold their breath or begin to drown. Each round, a creature can attempt a @Check[athletics|dc:40] check to Swim up near the surface or to keep their head above water for the remainder of the minute once they reach the surface.

At the start of the next four minutes, the megatsunami has carried each unprepared character 250 feet inland. At this time, each unprepared character takes @Damage[(3d12+20)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save). A character who managed that minute to remain near the surface gains a result one degree of success better than their actual rolled result, with a critical success indicating they've managed to clamber out of the surge onto high ground and are now prepared.

At the end of the five minutes, attempt a @Check[flat|dc:18] to determine if a new wave repeats the routine. Characters already swept inland only become affected by these following waves once the rushing water reaches them, but until then they can Swim in the choppy floodwaters with a successful @Check[athletics|dc:30] check, potentially reaching safety or high ground before the next wave hits. Once a region is flooded by a megatsunami, it typically remains flooded for several hours.
Megatsunami.name: Megatsunami

Meteor Shower.description: Impact from a sufficiently large asteroid would be powerful enough to wipe out a region or destroy a planet, but smaller-scale impact events, like from a meteor shower, present hazards that could be survived. This shower might arise naturally, or it might be the result of the PCs or other forces preventing a greater calamity by breaking a world-rending asteroid into smaller pieces.
Meteor Shower.hazardDisable: @Check[Astronomy Lore|dc:40] (master) or @Check[nature|dc:50] (legendary) to predict the trajectory of the falling asteroids and determine safe zones, @Check[athletics|dc:45] (legendary) or @Check[crafting|dc:47] (master) to dig underground shelters, @Check[diplomacy|dc:45] (master) or @Check[intimidation|dc:47] (master) to coordinate an orderly evacuation
Meteor Shower.hazardRoutine: (1+ minutes, @Check[flat|dc:17]) Small asteroids rain down across the sky, battering and incinerating those caught in their path before carving craters. Over the course of a minute, enough asteroids smash into the ground and explode to inflict @Damage[6d10[bludgeoning],14d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to any unprepared characters in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save). The @Template[type:burst|distance:40]{40-foot-radius} craters left behind are greater difficult terrain.
Meteor Shower.name: Meteor Shower

Meteor Shower (Escalation).description: Impact from a sufficiently large asteroid would be powerful enough to wipe out a region or destroy a planet, but smaller-scale impact events, like from a meteor shower, present hazards that could be survived. This shower might arise naturally, or it might be the result of the PCs or other forces preventing a greater calamity by breaking a world-rending asteroid into smaller pieces.
Meteor Shower (Escalation).hazardDisable: @Check[Astronomy Lore|dc:40] (master) or @Check[nature|dc:50] (legendary) to predict the trajectory of the falling asteroids and determine safe zones, @Check[athletics|dc:45] (legendary) or @Check[crafting|dc:47] (master) to dig underground shelters, @Check[diplomacy|dc:45] (master) or @Check[intimidation|dc:47] (master) to coordinate an orderly evacuation
Meteor Shower (Escalation).hazardRoutine:
(1+ minutes, @Check[flat|dc:17]) Small asteroids rain down across the sky, battering and incinerating those caught in their path before carving craters. Over the course of a minute, enough asteroids smash into the ground and explode to inflict @Damage[7d10[bludgeoning],14d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to any unprepared characters in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:46|basic] save). The @Template[type:burst|distance:40]{40-foot-radius} craters left behind are greater difficult terrain.

The material raining down from outer space includes chunks of adamantine. Adamantine's ability to break through the Hardness of materials is particularly lethal at terminal velocity. The falling adamantine has Hardness 20, allowing the asteroid's bludgeoning damage to overcome the Hardness of all materials with less Hardness, including shelters that would otherwise provide cover. Cover that's destroyed by the bludgeoning damage provides no protection against the fire damage.
Meteor Shower (Escalation).name: Meteor Shower (Escalation)

Mirror of Glory.description: A reflective field of energy fills a large archway in a gatehouse, in which viewers regard themselves dressed in fine clothes, bowing down before Runelord Xanderghul.
Mirror of Glory.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:37] (master) to disrupt one of the six anchor points that link the paradigm cube to the mirror, @Check[arcana|dc:34] (legendary) to use knowledge of magic that opposes pride to unravel the mirror's power, @Check[intimidation|dc:37] (master) to use one's force of personality to stand against the arrogance amplified by the mirror, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th-rank; counteract DC 36) to counteract one of the six faces of the paradigm cube; six successes are required to disable the Mirror of Glory
Mirror of Glory.hazardRoutine:
(6 actions) On its turn, the Mirror of Glory targets random PCs in the area with distortions of their reality, spending an action to target one PC. If it has actions remaining after targeting the PCs, it spends any remaining actions repairing damage done to itself at the rate of 25 HP restored per action spent. If the mirror hasn't been damaged, then these unused actions are lost. Each time the Mirror of Glory targets a PC with a distortion, roll 1d6 and consult the entries below to determine what the PC experiences and any subsequent effects. The trap loses one action for each successful check made to disable it, but this doesn't reduce the number of distortions it's capable of creating. When a PC experiences a distortion, they take @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:37|basic] save), but on a failed saving throw, the PC suffers that distortion's additional effect.

1—Beauty: The PC regards Xanderghul as the most attractive figure they've ever seen. Additional effect: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

2—Cruelty: The PC sees Xanderghul as a demonic figure capable of unimaginable cruelty, who lashes out at the PC with dozens of blades and poisoned needles meant to carve away their strength. Additional effect: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 24 hours.

3—Disappointment: To the PC, Xanderghul suddenly seems to be an intimidating parental figure, commanding officer, or other person with authority whose disapproval induces tremors of nervousness. Additional effect: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 24 hours.

4—Jealousy: The PC watches as a glorious plume of peacock tail feathers spreads behind Xanderghul, filling them with jealousy and potentially driving them to lash out unpredictably against their allies in hopes of becoming the only one worthy of Xanderghul's attention. Additional effect: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round. 5—Despair: The PC feels their own flesh rotting away as they realize the Xanderghul who stands before them exists outside of the laws of time. Additional effect: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

6—Worship: The PC is filled with the conviction that Xanderghul is the one true god and feels the urge to pray to him for absolution. Additional effect: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}.
Mirror of Glory.name: Mirror of Glory

Misery Siktempora.description:
Creatures born of intense pain and suffering, the armless, six-legged misery siktemporas are some of the most numerous of their kind since misery is as ubiquitous an experience as living. They're also the most proactive of siktemporas, seeking to propagate the misery from which they spawn. They delight in opportunities to travel to the Material Plane, where misery is so woefully prevalent and easily multiplied.

In the Dimension of Time, intense emotions are more than just ethereal feelings. They accumulate over time, from things like the critical mass of emotion caused by a historic event or a settlement passing down a powerful sentiment for generations. These accretions eventually give birth to siktemporas. Each siktempora feels, with all their being, a singular intense emotion linked to the circumstances that spawned them. A rare few, however, are created when an emotionally invested creature attempts to travel to the Dimension of Time or interferes with the flow of time, which can create paradoxes or manipulate past events.

Siktemporas usually isolate themselves on the Dimension of Time in mindscapes infused with the emotion that created them, but some travel to other planes. These wanderers long to indulge in more of their core emotion or to engender more of that feeling, thus perpetuating their own kind.

0a3piFjb7YtsWrsN.description:
Trigger The misery siktempora rolls Dimension of Time Lore for initiative

Effect The misery siktempora Strides once and makes a claw Strike, in either order.
0a3piFjb7YtsWrsN.name: Uncanny Pounce

OoyUDyw74uN0JNYI.name: Regeneration 40 (Deactivated by Mental, Orichalcum, or Vitality)

alp4ZDrGM2zotNDt.description: Creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied} condition are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the misery siktempora.
alp4ZDrGM2zotNDt.name: Slash the Suffering

hfaAY55AoAQW59YR.description:
Requirements The misery siktempora's last action was a claw Strike that damaged the target

Effect The misery siktempora fills the target's thoughts with abject despair. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:32] save. Regardless of outcome, the target is then immune to Inflict Misery for 1 minute.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round.

Critical Failure As failure, but for 1 minute.
hfaAY55AoAQW59YR.name: Inflict Misery

kQNlQmU6whlWK7M9.description:
The misery siktempora assails the mind of one creature within 100 feet with a wail of anguish and torment that deals @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:32|basic] save).

On a failed save, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for the first action of its next turn (or for 1 round on a critical failure).
kQNlQmU6whlWK7M9.name: Telepathic Wail

qVbkGmZA4J4JEc5c.description: A siktempora can always roll Dimension of Time Lore for initiative. When it does, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to the roll.
qVbkGmZA4J4JEc5c.name: Temporal Sense

Misery Siktempora.name: Misery Siktempora
Misery Siktempora.npcHp: regeneration 40 (deactivated by mental, orichalcum, or vitality)

Natbakh.description:
Natbakhs are native to the peaks and subterranean caverns of the windswept dimension of Leng and haunt the dark skies of that nightmare realm.

Nightmare Eruptions

In places where the boundaries between Golarion and Leng are thin, such as the depths of the Kodar Mountains, natbakhs have a particularly horrifying method of entering the waking world. If they consume the dreaming persona of someone sleeping near such thin places, they can burst forth from that sleeper's body, killing them in life as well as in their dream, often leaving the now-dead dreamer's home in splinters before flying off to build a lair in the mountains. Such "nightmare eruptions" are rare, but it doesn't take many natbakhs to leave a mark in a region unprepared for their arrival.

6II0398IU0qwyA22.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements The natbakh's previous action was a successful jaws Strike that damaged a creature

Effect The natbakh's suckered tongue latches on. The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:34] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for 1 week as their dreams are slurped away. If the creature becomes stupefied in this way, the natbakh regains @Damage[32[healing]] HP. Draining dreams from a creature that's already stupefied doesn't restore any HP, but increases the victim's stupefied value by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 5}.
6II0398IU0qwyA22.name: Drain Dreams

DnqApcPCQjaMtgZr.description: A natbakh can Fly at half Speed while it has a Huge or smaller creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, or at full speed when it has a Medium or smaller creature grabbed or restrained, carrying that creature along with it.
DnqApcPCQjaMtgZr.name: Writhing Clutches

GqIkxxArJz4KEIkJ.description:
The natbakh shrieks in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] that echoes more in the minds of those in the area than in the ears. Those in the area recall shrieks like this in forgotten nightmares, and the memories of wounds suffered in dreams cause nauseating pain. Creatures in the area take @Damage[10d8[mental]|options:area-damage] damage and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:34] save. The natbakh can't use Nightmare Screech again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Nightmare Screech]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is sickened 2, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as they remain sickened (or 1 minute, whichever comes first).
GqIkxxArJz4KEIkJ.name: Nightmare Screech

IXAW4HyPgGGs1aLX.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The natbakh ends one condition affecting them.
IXAW4HyPgGGs1aLX.name: Remove a Condition

R4zZQfekSIVw13nI.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect The natbakh attempts its next Athletics or Stealth skill check with a +4 bonus and is considered to have mythic proficiency for that check.
R4zZQfekSIVw13nI.name: Mythic Skill

Natbakh.name: Natbakh

Nightmare Feast.description: The consumption of sentient, and even sapient creatures is widespread in Leng. Those who suffer such fates are as much the genesis of this nightmare as those who partake, and as such, this nightmare tends to manifest in places where meals were taken, from banquet halls to campsites.
Nightmare Feast.hazardDisable: @Check[society|dc:43] (master) to fight these destructive urges by focusing your thoughts on traditions not so steeped in cruelty, or @Check[intimidation|dc:40] (legendary) to overwhelm the nightmare's influence with the strength of your own personality; three successes are required to disable the nightmare
Nightmare Feast.hazardReset: The nightmare deactivates as soon as a round begins with no creatures in its area, and resets in [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds}.
Nightmare Feast.hazardRoutine:
(1 action) The nightmare transitions from directly chewing on the creatures in the area to compelling them to feed for themselves. Each round on the nightmare's turn, all creatures within 30 feet of the nightmare's epicenter must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] save with the following results.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The nightmare causes a momentary change to the creature's appearance, causing its jaws to take on a frightening, fanged appearance and filling the creature's mind with distracting, unsettling hunger that cause them to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of the nightmare feast's next turn.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} until the start of the nightmare feast's next turn and gains a +30 bite (magical) that deals @Damage[(3d12+10)[slashing]] damage plus @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage on a hit. The creature favors this bite Strike when the confusion drives them to attack.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} and can use the extra action to make bite Strikes.
Nightmare Feast.name: Nightmare Feast

Peacock Phoenix.description:
Unlike its namesake, the peacock phoenix is a being of pure magic, a unique manifestation of Xanderghul's alter ego as the Peacock Spirit.

Other Mythic Phoenixes

Because it's tied so intrinsically to Runelord Xanderghul and his alter ego, the Peacock Spirit, once the peacock phoenix is destroyed, it's doubtful Golarion will ever see its like again. Whether different kinds of mythic phoenixes, born from similar confluences of magical and psychic energy, could ever exist remains uncertain.

DP4eJ5JKl0dr226b.description: 20 feet. The peacock phoenix is surrounded by an aura of iridescence. An adjacent creature that starts its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:35] save. On a failure, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until the start of its next turn.
DP4eJ5JKl0dr226b.name: Radiant Panoply

i5UzlQWjR31WWy7g.description: The phoenix emits a @Template[type:line|distance:100] of radiance from their eyes. Creatures in the area take @Damage[10d12[force]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic] save). The phoenix peacock can't use Radiant Beam again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Radiant Beam]]{1d4 rounds}.
i5UzlQWjR31WWy7g.name: Radiant Beam

oK7XTNom981cXJRd.description: When the peacock phoenix dies while incorporeal, they return to life at the start of their next turn with full Hit Points. They are no longer incorporeal, lose the spirit trait, gain the beast trait, and lose their immunities and resistances (except for mythic resistance) and radiant panoply. Their Strength modifier becomes +7. They lose their radiant wing Strike and gain a beak and talon Strike.
oK7XTNom981cXJRd.name: Rebirth

Peacock Phoenix.name: Peacock Phoenix
Peacock Phoenix.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Phantom of Desire.description: A rumor can become so vivid and so persistent that it comes to life, creating a brainchild-a living illusion that hatches from an intense belief in a remorseless and implacable killer. Often, these rumors swirl around the victims of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlcrVRqW1MSKJ5IC]{Phantasmal Killer} spell. A brainchild's capabilities grow when they pursue a believer but deflate against skeptics, making them only as bad as one thinks they are. A simple drive to stalk, terrify, and kill propels a brainchild, but the creature might also exhibit other behaviors ascribed to them through gossip.

6u4WiGSgJcSBMIVQ.description: Anything spoken by the phantom of desire is perceived by the listener in its native language.
6u4WiGSgJcSBMIVQ.name: Universal Language

OyVVhjJmaB7bDO28.description: When a phantom of desire hits a creature with an intrusive thought Strike, the creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:38] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.
OyVVhjJmaB7bDO28.name: Delusional Aspiration

WGNWlGz6rBHfdLEG.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The phantom telepathically reaches into the mind of another creature, offering to make their dreams come true. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save to avoid becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} by the distraction (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) until the start of the phantom's next turn.
WGNWlGz6rBHfdLEG.name: Enticing Charade

X8q0VOcCAdQbazmw.description:
This phantom is a manifestation of the pernicious rumors throughout the Inner Sea region that Sorshen is hiding her true intentions as ruler of New Thassilon and is biding her time for a chance to reveal her true motives to the world once she's lulled everyone into a false sense of security. A PC who Seeks or Senses Motive on a phantom of desire with a @Check[perception|dc:44] check realizes that the phantom of desire doesn't actually do additional bleed damage with her strikes, doesn't have her Enticing Charade ability, and doesn't have any innate spells at all. Unlike the typical brainchild, phantoms of desire are fully created by the animus of longing; they do not possess the typical Persistence of Memory ability most brainchildren have.

A brainchild is sustained only by the reputation that precedes them. Mindless creatures are immune to a brainchild and can't perceive them.

The brainchild's size, features, and items, as well as the appearance of their attacks, match what the foes perceiving them expect. If foes expect to see different things, the brainchild chooses which to manifest. If any creature that can perceive the brainchild believes the brainchild has one of the abilities below, the brainchild has that ability.

A creature can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Sense Motive} (against the brainchild's Deception DC) to attempt to disbelieve an individual ability. If at any point no creature perceiving the brainchild believes in the ability, the brainchild loses that ability immediately. If foes expect different particulars, such as one believing the brainchild is immune to fire and another believing they're immune to divinations, the brainchild chooses one to have.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]{Tremorsense} (imprecise) 100 feet
  • Immunity to one damage type, magic school, or condition
  • Weakness 10 to one damage type other than mental
  • Resistance 10 to physical damage, with an exception for either cold iron or silver
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.etMnv73EIdEZrYYu]{Frightful Presence} (aura, emotion, fear, mental) 100 feet, DC 28
  • [[/r 1d6]]{1d6} Extra Damage on Strikes, of a type one foe believes in
  • Additional Spells @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.R8bqnYiThB6MYTxD]{Phantom Pain} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IqJ9URobmJ9L9UBG]{Shadow Blast} at 6th rank
X8q0VOcCAdQbazmw.name: Urban Legend

Phantom of Desire.name: Phantom of Desire

Pridespawn Sentinel.description:
Sinspawn were created by one of seven ancient wizards known collectively as runelords—each of whom embraced and embodied one of seven sins. The first sinspawn was created by the Runelord of Wrath, utilizing techniques that have since gone on to influence fleshwarping practices. It wasn't long before the technique used to create sinspawn fell into the hands of the other runelords, and while each tried their own hand at crafting variants of their own design, today, sinspawn of wrath remain the most numerous and notorious of their kind.

Bearing only a vague resemblance to the humanoids from whose flesh they were formed, sinspawn generally appear horrifically emaciated and have unnaturally long arms and digitigrade legs, each with a trio of stubby, taloned digits. Veins bulge across sinspawn's bodies in sanguine patterns that suspiciously resemble twisted runes, and their flesh is pale and hairless. Their heads are elongated, with slits for a nose, red eyes, and disturbing lower jaws that split in half at the chin, revealing pedipalps that end in tiny, three-fingered hands and framing a long, lolling tongue.

Sinspawn stand 6-1/2 feet tall and typically weigh as much as an emaciated human of their size. They behave in a manner consistent with their associated sin and have physical characteristics that hint at these qualities. For example, greedspawn's veins appear to run with gold, while envyspawn appear even more gaunt than the rest of their kin.

9JLmJEt9BAzZKueL.description:
The pridespawn sentinel stumbles back and appears frightened and intimidated by a creature within 30 feet that it can see. The targeted creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:32] save; regardless of the result, that creature is temporarily immune to False Pride for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.
